desino: <entryFree id="n13385" type="main" key="de_si^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sĭno</orth>, <itype>sĭi</itype> (rarely īvi, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 35, 4</bibl>, v. Neue, Form. II. 404; also, <sense id="n13385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sync. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">desit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:26:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 26, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 24, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:16:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 16, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">desissem, Catull. 36, 5 al.: DESI, dissyl.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 71</bibl></cit>), <itype>sĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>—Prop., to put or set down; hence, <hi rend="ital">to leave off, give over, cease, desist</hi> (opp. coepi, the construction of which it for the most part follows; cf. for syn.: cesso, cunctor, tergiversor, defugio, haesito, moror, tardor; desisto, omitto, intermitto, praetermitto, praetereo, etc.). </sense><sense id="n13385.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n13385.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf. act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud jam mirari desino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:14:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 14, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te uti teste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commemorare eos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Bac. 1, 1, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacessere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:prol. 16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. prol. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maledicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:prol. 22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. prol. 22</bibl></cit>: de compositione loqui, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> et saep.—Less freq., </sense><sense id="n13385.3" n="(b)" level="5"> with <hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi ipsi Desierunt vorti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 19, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cerni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeri ab eo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inquiri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:616 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 616 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n13385.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">artem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:16:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 16, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:12:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">plura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 19</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">9, 66: Titania bella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:725" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 725</bibl></cit>: lugubres voces, Ap. Mag. 5, p.170 al.—</sense><sense id="n13385.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> (usually in the <hi rend="ital">tempp. perff.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">veteres orationes a plerisque legi sunt desitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:32:123" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 32, 123</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:8:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 8, 27</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">Persei numquam desitum celebrari nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censores creari desitos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermone abhinc multis annis jam desito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:10:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nectier postea desitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 34</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:13:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 13, 43</bibl>: coeptum per eos qui volebant, desitum est per hunc, qui decessit, id. Cornel. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 809</bibl> P.— In the <hi rend="ital">pres.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc bene desinitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 411</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13385.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to cease, stop, end, close</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. period). </sense><sense id="n13385.7" n="A" level="2"> In gen.:' omne bellum sumi facile, ceterum aegerrume desinere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 83:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 83, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrea primum desinet gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desierant imbres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desinat ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera, fragilia et caduca occidunt desinuntque,</quote> <trans><tr>perish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 10, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cauda desinit in piscem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 727</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 211</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 92:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 92, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:24:26" default="NO">24, 26</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 33, 51, § 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(gemma) ad vini colorem accedens, prius quam eum degustet, in viola desinit fulgor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 40, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pyrenaeus desinens,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>their extreme end</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:46" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13385.8" n="A" level="2"> With <case>abl.</case> and <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quo desinimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 597</bibl></cit>; or <case>abl.</case> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">desine quaeso communibus locis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 25, 80</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> (like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pau/ein</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">lh/gein</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">querelarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 2, 9, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:84" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 84</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Absol.: Mi.</hi> Ah! pergisne? <hi rend="ital">De.</hi> Jam jam desino, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut incipiendi (sc. sermonem) ratio fuerit, ita sit desinendi modus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. incipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:35" default="NO">11, 3, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo ex genere coeperis translationes, hoc desinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 50</bibl></cit>: cantasse eum publice <hi rend="ital">Oedipodem exsulem</hi> atque in hoc desisse versu: <foreign lang="greek">*qanei=n m) a)nw=|ge</foreign>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a praeceptis incipio, desino in exemplis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 2:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—In colloq. lang. desine sometimes like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pau=e</foreign> (cf. Lidd. and Scott, under <foreign lang="greek">pau/w</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.), <hi rend="ital">leave off! give over! stop! be still!</hi> etc.: <hi rend="ital">Ba.</hi> Heu, heu, heu! <hi rend="ital">Ps.</hi> Desine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 51</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:56 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 56 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n13385.9" n="B" level="2"> Esp., in rhetor., of the close of a period, <hi rend="ital">to end, close</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa, quae similiter desinunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 54</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:42" default="NO">9, 4, 42</bibl> et saep.; cf. cado, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.</sense></entryFree>
desioculus: <entryFree id="n13386" type="main" key="de_si^o^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsĭŏcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>desino-oculus</etym>, <sense id="n13386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who has lost an eye</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:59:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 59, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
desipientia: <entryFree id="n13387" type="hapax" key="de_si^pi^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsĭpĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>desipio</etym>, <sense id="n13387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">want of understanding, foolishness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:499" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 499</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
desipio: <entryFree id="n13388" type="main" key="de_si^pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sĭpĭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype> (<sense id="n13388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> desipui, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 4</bibl>, <cb n="DESO" /> 4), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sapio</etym>. * </sense><sense id="n13388.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to render insipid</hi> (late Lat. and rare), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 13</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n13388.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to be void of understanding, to be silly, foolish; to act foolishly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">summos viros desipere, delirare, dementes esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:34:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 34, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">licet me desipere dicatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:23:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 23, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 9 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dulce est desipere in loco,</quote> <trans><tr>to indulge in trifling</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 4, 12, 28</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">desipiebam mentis, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quippe mortale aeterno jungere desipere est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:802" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 802</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 165</bibl> and 1043.—Of a person in a fever, etc., <hi rend="ital">to be delirious, to rave</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 18 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit> —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsĭpĭens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., foolish, silly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">desipientis arrogantiae est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:6:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: estne quisquam ita desipiens, qui, etc. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:23:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 23, 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
desisto: <entryFree id="n13389" type="main" key="de_sisto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sisto</orth>, <itype>stĭti, stĭtum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n13389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> destitĕrunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:975" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 975</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> (for syn. v. desino <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n13389.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to set down</hi>: in scopulo puellam, Ap. M. 4, p. 157 (<bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 3, 174, 1</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n13389.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13389.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To stand off</hi> from a thing, <hi rend="ital">to stand apart</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tu tristis es? quid illa autem abs te irata destitit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 59</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13389.4" n="B" level="2"> Hence, of an action, <hi rend="ital">to leave off, cease, give over, desist from</hi> (freq. and class.).—Constr. with <hi rend="ital">de, ab</hi>, or simple <case>abl.</case>, the <case>dat.</case>, the <hi rend="ital">inf., quin</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> (in class. prose most freq. with the simple <case>abl.</case>, or with the <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">verbo de sententia destitisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:12:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de illa mente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de petitione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:58:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 58, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de diutina contentione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timoth. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a defensione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 12, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:28:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 28, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab oppugnatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab operibus suis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 16, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc conatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 26, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppugnatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:39:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 39, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itinere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fuga,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12, 2</bibl></cit> (with fugere, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 53</bibl>, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>): <cit><quote lang="la">sententia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 31, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impio bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incepto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 37</bibl>.—With <case>dat.</case>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 441</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:273" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 273</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regem flagitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de isdem scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locupletare cives,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causas agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:91:314" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 91, 314</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem timere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:49:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 49, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam polliceri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Inachia furere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:11:5" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">persequi aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:23:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 23, 28</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque, eam quin inveniam, desistam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; Vatin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 10</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: desiste; <cit><quote lang="la">recte ego rem meam sapio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:825" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 825</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 3</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ter in primo destitit ore sonus,</quote> <trans><tr>stuck in my throat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:823" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 823</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">desistente auctumno,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>coming to a close</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
desitus: <entryFree id="n13390" type="main" key="de_si^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from desino.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n13391" type="hapax" key="de_si^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [1. sero], <sense id="n13391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sown</hi> or <hi rend="ital">planted deep</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:23:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 23, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n13392" type="hapax" key="de_si^tus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>desino</etym>, <sense id="n13392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ceasing</hi>: spiritus, Jul. Valer. rer. gest. Alex. M. 3, 87.</sense></entryFree>
desivare: <entryFree id="n13393" type="gloss" key="de_si_vare"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsīvare</orth>, <itype>desinere</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=72:13" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 72, 13</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
desolatio: <entryFree id="n13394" type="main" key="de_so_la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsōlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>desolo</etym>, <sense id="n13394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a desolating, desolation</hi> (eccl. Lat.). </sense><sense id="n13394.1" n="I" level="1"> Abstr.: <cit><quote lang="la">in sua desolatione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Baruch, 4, 33</bibl></cit>; Salv. Gub. Dei, 6, p. 214: templi, Hilar. in Psa. 58, 7 al.—</sense><sense id="n13394.2" n="II" level="1"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a desert</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 7, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 44, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
desolator: <entryFree id="n13395" type="main" key="de_so_la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsōlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>desolo</etym>, <sense id="n13395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a waster, one who makes lonely</hi> or <hi rend="ital">desolate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Serm. 115" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Serm. 115</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 5; Hieron. in Amos, III. ad 7, 4 sq.</sense></entryFree>
desolatorius: <entryFree id="n13396" type="main" key="de_so_la_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsōlātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that makes lonely</hi> or <hi rend="ital">desolate</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:120:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 120, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 18</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 14.</sense></entryFree>
desolo: <entryFree id="n13397" type="main" key="de_so_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sōlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to leave alone, to forsake, abandon, desert</hi> (not anteAug., perh. first used by Verg.; most freq. in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n13397.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Verb finit.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">desolavimus agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 367</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agros profugiendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:3:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:917" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 917</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:78:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 78, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13397.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Part. perf., forsaken, deserted, left alone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">desolatae terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 349</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta domorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:653" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 653</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manipli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11</bibl></cit>, <cb n="DESP" /> 870.—So of persons, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1:233" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 1, 233</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 30</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:7:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 7, 3</bibl> (dub.); cf. with <hi rend="ital">abl., robbed, deprived of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">desolatus servilibus ministeriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 12, 16, § 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen magistro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:672" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 672</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aevo jam desolata senectus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>enfeebled by age</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 124</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">286</bibl>. —With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virorum gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:590" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 590</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
desolvo: <entryFree id="n13398" type="main" key="de_solvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-solvo</orth>, <itype>vi, lūtum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to pay</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:5:41:section=9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 5, 41, § 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
desomnis: <entryFree id="n13399" type="hapax" key="de_somnis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-somnis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>somnus</etym>, <sense id="n13399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sleepless</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 47, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
desorbeo: <entryFree id="n13400" type="main" key="de_sorbe^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sorbĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n13400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to swallow down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vortex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 24 al.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 804</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
despectatio: <entryFree id="n13401" type="hapax" key="de_specta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēspectātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>despecto</etym>, <sense id="n13401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a looking down, a prospect</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl> dub. (al. disparationes).</sense></entryFree>
despectator: <entryFree id="n13402" type="main" key="de_specta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēspectātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who looks down;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">a despiser</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">divinarum sententiarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Uxor. 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
despectio: <entryFree id="n13403" type="main" key="de_specti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēspectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>despicio</etym>, <sense id="n13403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a looking down upon;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">a despising, contempt</hi>: humanarum opinionum, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 288, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">effundit despectionem super principes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 12, 21 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
despecto: <entryFree id="n13404" type="main" key="de_specto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēspecto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n13404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. intens. a.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to look down upon</hi> any thing from a height (perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n13404.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex alto terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:624" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 624</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 396</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:710" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 710</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:699" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 699</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flammas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 409</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procul palantes animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:151 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 151 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n13404.2" n="B" level="2"> Of a high place, <hi rend="ital">to overlook</hi> or <hi rend="ital">command</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et quos maliferae despectant moenia Abellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:740" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 740</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spectacula Tarpeium prope despectantia culmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:7:24" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 7, 24</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 25, 3</bibl>, the true reading is spectat).—</sense><sense id="n13404.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to look down upon, to despise</hi> (used by Tac.): <cit><quote lang="la">liberos infra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ut victi et ignavi despectarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
despector: <entryFree id="n13405" type="main" key="de_spector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēspector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>despicio, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.</etym>, <sense id="n13405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a despiser</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
despectrix: <entryFree id="n13406" type="main" key="de_spectrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēspectrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>despector</etym>, <sense id="n13406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that despises, a despiser</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi (virtus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
despectus: <entryFree id="n13407" type="main" key="de_spectus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēspectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from despicio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n13408" type="main" key="de_spectus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēspectus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>despicio</etym>. <sense id="n13408.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A looking down upon;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">a view</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prospect</hi> from an elevated place (repeatedly in Caes.; elsewh. rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): erat ex oppido Alesia despectus in campum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:79:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 79, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 14</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub terras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 417</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua longe pelago despectus aperto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:351" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 351</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, concr., <hi rend="ital">points of view, heights</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ex omnibus partibus altissimas rupes despectusque haberet (oppidum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 29, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13408.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (only <case>dat.</case>), <hi rend="ital">a spectacle, an object of contempt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">despectui me habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 16, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2</bibl> Esdr. 4, 4.—</sense><sense id="n13408.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A despising, contempt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludibrio et despectui esse oppositum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 39, 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
desperabilis: <entryFree id="n13409" type="hapax" key="de_spe_ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēspērābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>despero</etym>, <sense id="n13409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">incurable, desperate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plaga mea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:15:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 15, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
desperanter: <entryFree id="n13410" type="main" key="de_spe_ranter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēspēranter</orth>, <sense id="n13410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., desperately, hopelessly</hi>, v. despero <hi rend="ital">fin., no.</hi> 1.</sense></entryFree>
desperate: <entryFree id="n13411" type="main" key="de_spe_ra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēspērātē</orth>, <sense id="n13411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., hopelessly</hi>, etc., v. despero, <hi rend="ital">P. a., no.</hi> 2. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
desperatio: <entryFree id="n13412" type="main" key="de_spe_ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēspērātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>despero</etym>, <sense id="n13412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hopelessness, despair</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">desperatio est aegritudo sine ulla rerum exspectatione meliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:8:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 8, 18</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n13412.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (good prose and very freq.). </sense><sense id="n13412.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium rerum amissio et desperatio recuperandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (opp. bona spes); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 2</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna pacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium salutis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 2</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13412.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna desperatione affectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad summam desperationem pervenire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:42:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 42, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad desperationem adducti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad desperationem redactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in desperatione esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 3:17:7" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 3, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad desperationem formidine properare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 46</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">a desperatione iram accendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">desperationes eorum, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13412.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">desperate boldness, foolhardiness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">desperatio truculentae feminae, Ap. M. 10, p. 251: periculosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,012:2:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Reg. 2, 26</bibl></cit>; id. Sirach, 27, 24. <pb n="559" /> <cb n="DESP" /></sense></entryFree>
desperatus: <entryFree id="n13413" type="main" key="de_spe_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēspērātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from despero.</entryFree>
desperno: <entryFree id="n13414" type="hapax" key="de_sperno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sperno</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n13414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to despise greatly, disdain</hi>: opes, Col. poët. 10, 298.</sense></entryFree>
despero: <entryFree id="n13415" type="main" key="de_spe_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-spēro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n13415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a., to be hopeless; to have no hope of, to despair of, to give up</hi> (freq. and class.).—Constr. most freq. with <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, the <case>acc.</case>, or <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.;</hi> less freq. with the <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n13415.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> (in Cic. rarely): <cit><quote lang="la">de sua virtute aut de ipsius diligentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 40, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de pugna,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 40, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de officio imperatoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 40, 10</bibl></cit>,: <cit><quote lang="la">de expugnatione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de salute,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 85, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de republica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 11</bibl></cit>, D, § <cit><quote lang="la">6: de summa rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 41</bibl></cit>: de se, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 15, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 24, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. An. 5:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. An. 5, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13415.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (in Caes. only in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:21:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 21, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rempublicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntariam deditionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra invicti Glyconis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 29:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 29, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:104:12" default="NO">104, 12</bibl>.—In the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive restituimur, sive desperamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus salus desperanda est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 24, 90</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nil desperandum Teucro duce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 7, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desperatis nostris rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 24, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 26, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">desperata salute,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">desperato improviso tumultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 14</bibl></cit> et saep.— <hi rend="ital">Middle</hi>: desperatis hominibus, <hi rend="ital">who gave themselves up</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">were desperately resolved, desperate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13415.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego non despero fore aliquem aliquando, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:21:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 21, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:21:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 21, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:12:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 12, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 150</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:724" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 724</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13415.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saluti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:25:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 25, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus tuis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 36, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suis fortunis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 50, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saluti suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 25</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive habes aliquam spem de republica sive desperas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12" default="NO">12</bibl> prooem. § 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 371</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">spem habere a tribuno plebis, a senatu desperasse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, * </sense><sense id="n13415.5" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēspēranter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., hopelessly, despairingly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui secum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 18, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13415.6" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēspērātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., given up, despaired of, irremediable, desperate</hi> (most freq. in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum collectum ex senibus desperatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remedium aegrotae ac prope desperatae reipublicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:21:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 21, 70</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">reipublicae morbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collegium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:10:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desperatas pecunias exigere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">desperatos vocant, quia corpori suo minime parcunt (of the Christians),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 9, 12</bibl></cit>. —Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">desperatis Hippocrates vetat adhibere medicinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 15, 5</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec nunc multo desperatiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 22</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perfugium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: spes, Balb. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7</bibl>, B, § 2.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēspērātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">desperately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non desperate sollicitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. ad Celer. 237" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. ad Celer. 237</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
despica: <entryFree id="n13416" type="main" key="despi^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">despĭca</orth>, v. <orth extent="full" lang="la">despĭcus</orth>.</entryFree>
despicabilis: <entryFree id="n13417" type="main" key="de_spi^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēspĭcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>despicor</etym>, <sense id="n13417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contemptible, despicable</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 8, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 28, § 3 al.</bibl>— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
despicatio: <entryFree id="n13418" type="hapax" key="de_spi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēspĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contempt. —Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">despicationes adversantur voluptatibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>sentiments of contempt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:20:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 20, 67</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
despicatus: <entryFree id="n13419" type="main" key="de_spi^ca_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēspĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from despicor.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n13420" type="main" key="de_spi^ca_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēspĭcātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>despicor</etym>, <sense id="n13420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">contempt</hi> (very rare, only in <case>dat.</case>): aliquem habere despicatui, <hi rend="ital">to despise</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 3, 19</bibl>: si quis despicatui ducitur, <hi rend="ital">is despised</hi>, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 27, 65</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
despicientia: <entryFree id="n13421" type="main" key="de_spi^ci^enti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēspĭcĭentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>despicio</etym>, <sense id="n13421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a despising, contempt</hi> (very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only in Cic.): in omnium rerum humanarum contemptione ac despicientia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum externarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in contemnendis honoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:23:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 23, 81</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
despicio: <entryFree id="n13422" type="main" key="de_spi^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-spĭcĭo</orth>, <itype>exi, ectum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n13422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. perf.</hi> despexe, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 72</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n13422.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To look down upon</hi> any thing (for syn. cf.: contemno, sperno, aspernor). </sense><sense id="n13422.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mestly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n13422.3" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: ad te per impluvium<cb n="DESP" />  tuum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 72</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de vertice montis in valles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:504" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 504</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a summo caelo in aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medios in agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:601" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 1, 601</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:30 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 7, 30 al.</bibl></cit>—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus suspicientis et despicientis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 8, 34, § 56</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles, qua despici poterat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 36, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13422.4" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis Pacuviano invehens curru multas et varias gentis et urbis despicere et oculis conlustrare possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 9, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter aethere summo Despiciens mare velivolum terrasque jacentis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 224</bibl></cit> (v. Conington ad loc.); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 178</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:569" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 569</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">e tumulis subjectam urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:488" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 488</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culmine cuncta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cavā montis convalle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 187</bibl></cit> (Forb. ad loc.): <cit><quote lang="la">quos (populos) despicit Arctos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 458</bibl></cit>.—(Acc. to Lachm. ad Lucr. vol. 2, p. 236, despicio with <case>acc.</case> always has the trop. force, <hi rend="ital">to despise;</hi> and in all these passages should be read <hi rend="ital">dispicere;</hi> and so Rib. in Verg., Munro ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:418" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 418</bibl>; cf. dispicio.)—</sense><sense id="n13422.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> as <hi rend="ital">v. act., to look down upon, to despise, disdain</hi> (class. and very freq. —syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">contemnere, spernere): ut omnes despiciat, ut hominem prae se neminem putet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 46 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">divitias (with contemnere honores),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:59:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 59, 3</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">ipsos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionem propter paucitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">copias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucitatem militum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ullum laborem aut munus,</quote> <trans><tr>to disdain, decline, shun</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">dum despicis omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 438</bibl> et saep.—In <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines despecti et contempti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:40:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 40, 87</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">huic despecto saluti fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 2, 2</bibl></cit> (corresp. with contemptus and contemnentibus).—Partic. with the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">despiciens sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 89</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">extr.;</hi> and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">despectus taedae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:54" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 54</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n13422.6" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To look away, not to regard, not to attend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul atque ille despexerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 8, 22</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēspectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">contemptible, despicable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 47</bibl></cit>: Euphrates, ingens modo, inde tenuis rivus, despectus emoritur, Mela, 3, 8, 5.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: improbos despectiores facere, Boëth. Cons. Phil. 3, pros. 4, p. 47 Obbar.</sense></entryFree>
despicor: <entryFree id="n13423" type="main" key="de_spi^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēspĭcor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [despicio, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. B.), <hi rend="ital">to despise, disdain</hi> (very rare): aliquem, Q. Pompeius ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 793</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Vir. Ill. 23" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Vir. Ill. 23</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēspĭcā-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in a <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> sense, <hi rend="ital">despised</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vir me habet despicatam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit> and 19; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 92</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13423.1" n="B" level="2"> As <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">despicatissimus homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:chapter=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">contemptissimi ac despicatissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:41:section=98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 41, § 98</bibl></cit> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi></sense></entryFree>
despicus: <entryFree id="n13424" type="main" key="de_spi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēspĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">despised, disdained</hi>, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 155, 26</bibl> (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Fragm. Com. v. 25</bibl>; cf. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2, p. 307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, p. 307</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
desplendesco: <entryFree id="n13425" type="main" key="de_splendesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-splendesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n13425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n. inch., to cease to shine, to lose its brightness</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
despoliatio: <entryFree id="n13426" type="main" key="de_spo^li^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēspŏlĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>despolio</etym>, <sense id="n13426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a robbing, despoiling</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 7</bibl>; of a <hi rend="ital">fine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 9, 17, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
despoliator: <entryFree id="n13427" type="main" key="de_spo^li^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēspŏlĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a robber, plunderer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 16, 2, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
despolio: <entryFree id="n13428" type="main" key="de_spo^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-spŏlĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (also <sense id="n13428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dep.</hi>: quos despoliatur, with depopulatur, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 480, 13</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">to rob, plunder, despoil</hi> (rare, but good prose).—Constr., <hi rend="ital">aliquem (aliquid) aliqua re</hi>: ne se armis despoliaret, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 31, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me despoliat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 53</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 5, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dianae templum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitos suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">despoliari triumpho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
despondeo: <entryFree id="n13429" type="main" key="de_sponde^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-spondĕo</orth>, <itype>spondi, sponsum, 2</itype> (<sense id="n13429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> despopondisse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 1, 2</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">plqpf.</hi> despoponderas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 51</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">with despondi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">despondisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit> et saep.), <hi rend="ital">v. a., to promise to give, to promise, pledge</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13429.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13429.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (rarely): <cit><quote lang="la">librum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Syriam homini,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum, hortos, Baias sibi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium Orientis Romanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 13</bibl></cit>: Tarpeias arces sibi (sc. <cb n="DESQ" /> diripiendas, with promittere), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:758" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 758</bibl>.— Far more freq. and class., </sense><sense id="n13429.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to promise in marriage, to betroth, engage</hi>: qui spoponderat filiam, despondisse dicebatur, quod <hi rend="ital">de sponte</hi> ejus, id est de voluntate exierat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=71" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 71</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">filiam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:56:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 56, 239</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:64:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 64, 179</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 715</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos uni viro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 11, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">placuit despondi (sc. eam),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 75</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sororem suam in tam fortem familiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">filiam suam in divitias maxumas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 3, 57</bibl></cit>. —Rarely with <hi rend="ital">sibi</hi>: Orestillae filiam sibi, <hi rend="ital">to espouse</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 7</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intus despondebitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 6, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13429.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, facete: <cit><quote lang="la">bibliothecam tuam cave cuiquam despondeas, quamvis acrem amatorem inveneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 10, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13429.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13429.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To promise, give up, devote to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spes reipublicae despondetur anno consulatus tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perjuria meritis poenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:509" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 509</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n13429.7" n="B" level="2"> With predom. idea of removing, putting away from one's self, <hi rend="ital">to give up, yield, resign</hi>. So esp. freq. in Plaut.: animum, <hi rend="ital">to lose courage, to despair, despond</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne lamentetur neve animum despondeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. prol. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 6</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">in the same sense, animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:22" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 22</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply, despondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:10:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientiam,</quote> <trans><tr>to despair of acquiring wisdom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: nempe quas spopondi? <hi rend="ital">St.</hi> Immo, quas despondi, inquito, <hi rend="ital">have got rid of by promising</hi>, i. e. by being security for others, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 25</bibl> Ritschl (Fleck. dependi).</sense></entryFree>
desponsatio: <entryFree id="n13430" type="main" key="de_sponsa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsponsātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>desponso</etym>, <sense id="n13430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a betrothing, betrothal</hi>, Tert. Verg. vel. 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,031:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Cant. 3, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
desponsio: <entryFree id="n13431" type="main" key="de_sponsi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsponsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>despondeo</etym>, <sense id="n13431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a despairing, desponding</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:18:176" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 18, 176</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:ib. 2:32:167" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 32, 167</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
desponso: <entryFree id="n13432" type="main" key="de_sponso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sponso</orth>, no <sense id="n13432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum, 1, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to betroth</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Orig. 13" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Orig. 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">viro justo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 10, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 1, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
desponsor: <entryFree id="n13433" type="gloss" key="de_sponsor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsponsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>despondeo</etym>, <sense id="n13433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who betroths</hi>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=69" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 69</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
desponsus: <entryFree id="n13434" type="main" key="de_sponsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsponsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from despondeo.</entryFree>
despumatio: <entryFree id="n13435" type="hapax" key="de_spu_ma_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēspūmātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>despumo</etym>, <sense id="n13435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a skimming off</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carn. Chr. 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
despumo: <entryFree id="n13436" type="main" key="de_spu_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-spūmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> (perh. not ante-Aug.). <sense id="n13436.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n13436.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To skim off, to skim</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13436.2" n="1" level="3"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">undam aeni foliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 38, 62, § 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mel Atticum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:38:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 38, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquam salsam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 25, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13436.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to work off, digest</hi> wine: <cit><quote lang="la">Falernum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">to rub off, polish</hi> a pavement: <cit><quote lang="la">pavimenti fastigium cote,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 62, § 187</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 4</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">to let blood, to bleed</hi> a horse, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> A.
