V. 3, 34, 2 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13436.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To deposit a frothy matter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 506</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Claud. in Prob. et Olyb. 54: Phoebe suppositas in herbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:506" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 506</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">despumantes suas confusiones,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>expressing by foaming</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judae, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13436.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to cease foaming, to slacken, abate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut nimius ille fervor despumet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquid lacrymarum affectus despumaverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 99:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 99, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 68</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
despuo: <entryFree id="n13437" type="main" key="de_spu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-spŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n13437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a., to spit out, to spit</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13437.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 40</bibl>; Naev. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:19:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 19, 6</bibl>; esp. as a religious observance for averting a disease, etc.; so, <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> morbos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 7, § 35</bibl>: tenerum ignem, Claud. rapt. Pros. 2, 52; <hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:27" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:54" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 33, § 69</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n13437.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to reject, abhor</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">deprecari, aspernari, spernere, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">preces alicujus, Catull. 50, 19: voluptates (with spernere opes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 104" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 104 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acre in mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:35" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 35</bibl></cit>, dub. (others: despuat, hi mores, etc.).</sense></entryFree>
desputamentum: <entryFree id="n13438" type="hapax" key="de_spu_ta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēspūtāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>despuo</etym>, <sense id="n13438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">spittle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 3, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
desputum: <entryFree id="n13439" type="main" key="de_spu_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēspūtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">spittle</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:20:195" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 20, 195</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
desquamo: <entryFree id="n13440" type="main" key="de_squa_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-squāmo</orth>, no <sense id="n13440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum, 1, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to scale off, to scale</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13440.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13440.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13440.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To peel off, to rub, scour, clean off</hi>: corticem, <pb n="560" /> <cb n="DEST" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 70, § 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus (vitis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrenum,</quote> <trans><tr>to shake off, scrape off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 8, 54, § 97</bibl></cit> et saep.: rador, subvellor, desquamor, pumicor, ornor, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 95, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13440.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēsquāmāta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> In medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">parts of the body from which the skin has been rubbed off, excoriated parts</hi>, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)posu/rmata</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 68, § 139</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:93 al" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 11, 55, § 93 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
desterno: <entryFree id="n13441" type="main" key="de_sterno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sterno</orth>, <itype>strāvi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to free from its covering</hi> (stratum), <hi rend="ital">to unsaddle, ungird</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">camelos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:24:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 24, 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
desterto: <entryFree id="n13442" type="hapax" key="de_sterto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sterto</orth>, <itype>tŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to cease snoring;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cease dreaming</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:10" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
destico: <entryFree id="n13443" type="hapax" key="de_sti^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēstĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n13443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to squeak</hi>, of the noise made by the shrew-mouse, Auct. Carm. Philom. 62.</sense></entryFree>
destillatio: <entryFree id="n13444" type="main" key="de_stilla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēstillātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>destillo</etym>, <sense id="n13444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dripping down, distilling;</hi> in medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">a rheum, catarrh, running</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 17, 71, § 183</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:139" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 25, 68, § 139</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">jecoris,</quote> <trans><tr>an abscess</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
destillo: <entryFree id="n13445" type="main" key="de_stillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-stillo</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">di-stillo</orth>), <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n13445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drip</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trickle down, to distil</hi> (not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n13445.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: lentum destillat ab inguine virus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:281" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 281</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex athere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de capite in nares humor (from a cold),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubes distillaverunt aquis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judic. 5, 4 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n13445.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora nardo,</quote> <trans><tr>to drop, distil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">destillante arboribus odore mirae suavitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 31, 36, § 198</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
destimulo: <entryFree id="n13446" type="main" key="de_sti^mu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-stĭmŭlo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">di-</orth>), <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n13446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to goad on, to stimulate</hi> (late Lat.), trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">exercendi stili amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 4:26" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 4, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 27, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
destina: <entryFree id="n13447" type="main" key="de_sti^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēstĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>destino</etym>, <sense id="n13447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a support, stay, prop</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, p. 92</bibl></cit>; probably also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 12, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
destinate: <entryFree id="n13448" type="main" key="de_sti^na_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēstĭnātē</orth>, <sense id="n13448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., resolutely, obstinately</hi>, etc.; v. destino <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
destinatio: <entryFree id="n13449" type="main" key="de_sti^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēstĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>destino</etym>, <sense id="n13449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a setting fast, establishing; a resolution, determination, purpose, design</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">depascitur segetes destinatione ante determinata in diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 25, 39, § 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticum ex destinatione M. Agrippae a sorore ejus inchoatam peregit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 2, 3, § 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulli' placere partium destinatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: consulum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the election</hi> (opp. renuntiatione), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:77:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 77, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:95:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 95, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 14, 21, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspirandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 45, 46, § 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quietis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3 praef" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aeternitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 114</bibl></cit> et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">certus destinationis, ne, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>resolute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13449.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp. <hi rend="ital">obstinacy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 10, 10 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
destinato: <entryFree id="n13450" type="main" key="de_sti^na_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēstĭnāto</orth>, v. <itype>destino</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
destinator: <entryFree id="n13451" type="main" key="de_sti^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēstĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n13451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who determines, designs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praevius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ennod.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
destinatum: <entryFree id="n13452" type="main" key="de_sti^na_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēstĭnātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and</entryFree>
destinatus: <entryFree id="n13453" type="main" key="de_sti^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēstĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, see the foll. art., <pos>P. a.</pos></entryFree>
destino: <entryFree id="n13454" type="main" key="de_sti^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-stĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>obs. stanare; a particip. stem from root STA, v. sto; and cf.: dono, digno, etc., Corss. 2, 416</etym>, <sense id="n13454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make fast, make firm, bind</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in the trop. sense—for syn. cf.: decerno, scisco, statuo, jubeo, constituo, sancio, definio). </sense><sense id="n13454.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">antemnas ad malos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 14, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rates ancoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 25, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falces (laqueis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; dub., v. destina.—</sense><sense id="n13454.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to establish, determine, resolve, consider; to design, intend, devote, destine; to appoint, choose, elect</hi> (syn.: definire, describere, designare, etc.). </sense><sense id="n13454.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (in Livy freq. connected with <hi rend="ital">animis</hi>, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>). </sense><sense id="n13454.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With double <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem consulem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Papirium parem destinant animis Magno Alexandro ducem, si, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">animis auctorem caedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:4:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 42, 4, 14</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13454.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">a clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infectis iis, quae agere destinaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:84" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:53 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 53 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">potiorem populi Romani quam regis Persei amicitiam habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 27, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:157 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 157 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13454.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi aliquid,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to intend purchasing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 113</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 23, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">operi destinati possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:72:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 72, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem foro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 8, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me arae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> A 2, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem necis alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:10:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 10, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domos publicis usibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:81" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 81 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: quod signum cuique <cb n="DEST" /> loco, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Anticyram omnem illis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cados tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Od. 2, 7, 20</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13454.7" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempore locoque ad certamen destinatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia ad bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiam ad scribendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:9 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 9 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad omne obsequium destinati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:28:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 28, 5</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxo aurove in aliud destinato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legati in provinciam destinati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctem proximam in fugam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13454.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n13454.9" n="1" level="3"> In the lang. of archers, slingers, etc., <hi rend="ital">to fix upon as a mark, to aim at</hi> ( = designare scopum): <cit><quote lang="la">locum oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:29:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 29, 7</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:54:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 54, 6</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittas,</quote> <trans><tr>to shoot at the mark</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 42" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 42</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13454.10" n="2" level="3"> In the lang. of trade: sibi aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to fix upon for one's self, to intend to buy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minis triginta sibi puellam destinat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 3, 1, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 3, 72</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 289, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 23, 3 al.</bibl>— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēstĭnātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">destined, fixed</hi> (syn.: fixus, certus). </sense><sense id="n13454.11" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certis quibusdam destinatisque sententiis quasi addicti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad horam mortis destinatam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 22, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si hoc bene fixum omnibus destinatumque in animo est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">persona (coupled with certus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:57" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 57</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 3</bibl>.—Destinatum est alicui, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> = certum est, <hi rend="ital">it is one's decision, will; he has determined</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:13:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 13, 5 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13454.12" n="B" level="2"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n13454.13" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēstĭnāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = sponsa, <hi rend="ital">a betrothed female, bride</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 27</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 16, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13454.14" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēs-tĭnātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n13454.15" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">A mark</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aim</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13454.16" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">An intended, determined object, design, intention</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque tuis neque Liviae destinatis adversabor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">destinata retinens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 32</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">antequam destinata componam,</quote> <trans><tr>the intended narration</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad destinatum persequor,</quote> <trans><tr>the goal of life</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Philip. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: destinata dare, <hi rend="ital">the intentions, dispositions</hi> of a will, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 5, 27</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ex destinato,</quote> <trans><tr>adv., designedly, intentionally</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ben. 6, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Cal. 43</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in a like sense merely destinato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:60" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 60</bibl></cit>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">dēstĭ-nātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> (perh. only in Ammianus), <hi rend="ital">resolutely, obstinately</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 2</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 20, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">23, 1</bibl>; 27, 3.</sense></entryFree>
destitor: <entryFree id="n13455" type="main" key="de_sti^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēstĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>desisto</etym>, <sense id="n13455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who desists, withdraws from a thing</hi>, Julian. Epit. nov. c. 51, § 192.</sense></entryFree>
destituo: <entryFree id="n13456" type="main" key="de_sti^tu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-stĭtŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>statuo</etym>. <sense id="n13456.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To set down; to set, place</hi> anywhere (ante-class. and freq. in Liv.; elsewh. rare): destituit omnes servos ad mensam ante se, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 280, 3</bibl>: navem in alto ancoris, Naev. ib.: palum in foro, C. Gracchus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in convivio (sc. ludendi causa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armatos in medio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ante tribunal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes extra vallum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo signa hic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 5, 43</bibl></cit> et saep.—Far more freq. and class., </sense><sense id="n13456.1" n="II" level="1"> (<usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, to put away from one's self; hence) <hi rend="ital">To leave alone, to forsake, abandon, desert</hi> (derelinquo, desero, q. v.): <cit><quote lang="la">T. Roscius novem homines honestissimos induxit, decepit, destituit, adversariis tradidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:40:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 40, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">destitutus ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:10:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 10, 32</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">funditores inermes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:93:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 93, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in septemviratu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:38:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 38, 99</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">defensores in ipso discrimine periculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 17</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">inceptam fugam,</quote> <trans><tr>to desist from</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:13:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 13, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morando spem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem vindemiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:24:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 24, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conata ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:42" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 42</bibl></cit>: partem verborum, <hi rend="ital">to pronounce indistinctly</hi> (with devorare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 33</bibl> Spald. et saep.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <case>acc.</case> and <case>abl.</case>: ex quo destituit deos Mercede pactā Laomedon, i. e. <hi rend="ital">defrauded of their stipulated reward</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 3, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13456.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Of inanimate and abstract subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">neque reperias, quos aut pronior fortuna comitata sit, aut, veluti fatigata, maturius destituerit, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:69" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 69 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum primas spes fortuna destituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:5:section=29" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 5, § 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:65" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem vadum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem poplites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem memoria, mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alveum fluitantem aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: freta destituent nudos in litore<cb n="DEST" />  pisces, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 61</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13456.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi> destitutus, constr. usu. ab aliquo, aliquā re, rarely ab aliquā re, freq. with <hi rend="ital">ab, abandoned, forsaken by; robbed of, destitute of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in divite ac paupere: propinquis, amicis, clientibus abundante, et his omnibus destituto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus consiliis, promissis, praeceptis destitutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientiā juris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lenociniis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 30</bibl></cit> et saep.; but with spe, <hi rend="ital">a</hi> is more freq.: <cit><quote lang="la">destituti ab unica spe auxilii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a spe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 33, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3</bibl> (with spe, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 6</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">a re familiari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13456.4" n="(d)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si is destituat, nihil satis tutum habebis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simul, si destituat spes, alia praesidia molitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 41</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Tib. 1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tib. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:728" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 728</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pietasque fidesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 298</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Isai. 49, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
destitutio: <entryFree id="n13457" type="main" key="de_sti^tu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēstĭtūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>destituo</etym>, <sense id="n13457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a forsaking, deserting; deceiving, a failure, disappointment</hi> (very rare), Cin. Clu. 26, 71; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 5, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13457.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A putting away, abandoning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">peccati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 9, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
destitutor: <entryFree id="n13458" type="main" key="de_sti^tu_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēstĭtūtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who forsakes, disappoints</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">deceives</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 83, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
destitutus: <entryFree id="n13459" type="main" key="de_sti^tu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēstĭtūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from destituo.</entryFree>
destrangulo: <entryFree id="n13460" type="main" key="de_strangu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-strangŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to choke, strangle;</hi> only trop., <hi rend="ital">to destroy</hi>: rem publicam, Pore. Latro decl. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
destrictarium: <entryFree id="n13461" type="main" key="de_strictari^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēstrictárĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>destringo</etym>, <sense id="n13461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the place in the baths where the body was rubbed down</hi>, Corp. Inscr. Lat. 1251.</sense></entryFree>
destricte: <entryFree id="n13462" type="main" key="de_stricte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēstrictē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. districte.</entryFree>
destrictivus: <entryFree id="n13463" type="main" key="de_stricti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēstrictīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>destringo</etym>, <sense id="n13463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dissolving, loosening</hi>, opp. constrictivus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:29" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
destrictus: <entryFree id="n13464" type="main" key="de_strictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēstrictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from destringo</entryFree>
destringo: <entryFree id="n13465" type="main" key="de_stringo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-stringo</orth>, <itype>inxi, ictum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n13465.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To strip off</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13465.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.), of the leaves of plants: <cit><quote lang="la">avenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:37:5" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 37, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:83" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bacam myrti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:38:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 38, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frondem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:317 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 317 al.</bibl></cit>—Of <hi rend="ital">rubbing</hi> the body in the bath, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:62" default="NO" valid="yes">62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:51" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 51</bibl>; hence also of <hi rend="ital">scouring out</hi> the intestines: <cit><quote lang="la">interanea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 9, 31, § 96</bibl></cit>. Esp. freq. of the sword; <hi rend="ital">to unsheathe, draw</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:31:112" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 31, 112</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 13 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:99" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 99</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">207</bibl> et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">hence also securim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13465.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">non laturi homines destringi aliquid et abradi bonis,</quote> <trans><tr>should be taken from</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:37:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 37, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13465.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To touch gently, to graze, skim, skirt</hi> (perh. only in the poets). </sense><sense id="n13465.4" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequora alis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:562" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 562</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus arundine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:526" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 526</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora summa sagittā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 16, 275</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, corpus harundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 382</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Cygnum cuspis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 101</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and even vulnus,</quote> <trans><tr>to cause a slight wound</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 364</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13465.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to criticise, censure, satirize</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quemquam mordaci carmine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:563" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 563</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alios gravi contumelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 29, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-strictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., severe, rigid, censorious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam destrictam egerunt censuram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:9:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 9, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quis destrictior accusator, velut sacrosanctus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
destructibilis: <entryFree id="n13466" type="main" key="de_structi^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēstructĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>destruo</etym>, <sense id="n13466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">destructible</hi>: omnia, Lact. de Ira D. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> (al. destructilia).</sense></entryFree>
destructilis: <entryFree id="n13467" type="main" key="de_structi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēstructĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">destructible</hi>: aedes, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 357; Lact. de Ira Dei, 23, § 28.</sense></entryFree>
destructio: <entryFree id="n13468" type="main" key="de_structi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēstructĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pulling down, destruction</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13468.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">murorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munitionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 10, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13468.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiarum (opp. confirmatio),</quote> <trans><tr>a refuting, refutation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">appetentiae,</quote> <trans><tr>disturbance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:21:203" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 21, 203</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
destructivus: <entryFree id="n13469" type="main" key="de_structi_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēstructīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">destructive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjutorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:84" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 84</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
destructor: <entryFree id="n13470" type="main" key="de_structor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēstructor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who pulls down, a destroyer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum, opp. aedificator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 46</bibl></cit>: Trojae, Cass. Var. 14, 15; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 112, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
destruo: <entryFree id="n13471" type="main" key="de_stru^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-strŭo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to pull</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tear down</hi> any thing built (opp. construo— <pb n="561" /> <cb n="DESU" /> for syn. cf.: demolior, diruo). </sense><sense id="n13471.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">navem, aedificium idem destruit facillime, qui construxit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 20, 72</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">templum prope funditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 326</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:34:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 34, 13</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13471.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">crinemque manumque, i. e.,</quote> <trans><tr>to strip off crown and sceptre</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:93" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 93</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13471.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to destroy, ruin, weaken</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">destruere ac demoliri aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:48" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem (opp. illustrare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">finitionem (opp. confirmare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulos testes (opp. exornare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:25 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 7, 25 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa vetustas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:132" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 132</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 235</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta vultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 312</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 3, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
desub: <entryFree id="n13472" type="main" key="de_sub"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sub</orth>, <sense id="n13472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">praep. c. abl., below, beneath</hi> (late Lat.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">desuper): desub Alpibus, id est, desub ipsis Italiae faucibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:3:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desub oculo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desub rivo, Innocent. de Cas. liter. p. 226 ed. Goes.: desub se,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucernam desub modio ejecit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Mythol. 3, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
desubito: <entryFree id="n13473" type="main" key="de_su^bi^to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sŭbĭtō</orth> (by many written separately, de subito), <sense id="n13473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., on a sudden, suddenly</hi> (except once in Cic., only ante-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Bac. 1, 1, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. prol. 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 1, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 39</bibl>; Lucil., Enn., Naev., al. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 517, 13</bibl>-518, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 265</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:643" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 643</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:2:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 2, 2</bibl> (ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 517</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
desubulo: <entryFree id="n13474" type="hapax" key="de_su_bu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sūbŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>subula</etym>, <sense id="n13474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bore in deeply</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perforare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 99, 30</bibl></cit>; trop.: viam, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 99, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
desuctus: <entryFree id="n13475" type="hapax" key="de_suctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-suctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from desugo.</entryFree>
desudaba: <entryFree id="n13476" type="main" key="Desuda_ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Desudāba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n13476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Thrace</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
desudasco: <entryFree id="n13477" type="hapax" key="de_su_dasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sūdasco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n13477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to sweat greatly.—Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi damnis desudascitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Bac. 1, 1, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
desudatio: <entryFree id="n13478" type="main" key="de_su_da_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsūdātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>desudo</etym>, <sense id="n13478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a violent sweating</hi> (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n13478.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: nimia corporis, Firm. Math. 3, 1.—</sense><sense id="n13478.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">exertion, painstaking;</hi> coupled with cura, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 577</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
desudo: <entryFree id="n13479" type="main" key="de_su_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sūdo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n13479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> (mostly post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n13479.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to sweat greatly</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13479.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:277" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 277</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13479.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to exert</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fatigue one's self</hi>: in his (sc. exercitationibus ingenii) desudans atque elaborans, *<bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 11, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alio Marte,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 280</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Eutrop. 2, 602</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laboribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccl. 2, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13479.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to sweat out, exude</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13479.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">balsama, Claud. Epithal. Pall. et Celer. 123: pestem in amnes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Rufin. 1, 304</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13479.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to perform with exertion</hi> (qs. with sweating): <cit><quote lang="la">excubias militiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
desuefacio: <entryFree id="n13480" type="main" key="de_su^e_fa^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsŭē-făcĭo</orth>, <itype>fēci, factum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>desueo</etym>, <sense id="n13480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to disuse, disaccustom, bring out of use</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">catuli (a matre) minutatim desuefiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: multitudo desuefacta a contionibus, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:40:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 40, 110</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pall. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
desuefio: <entryFree id="n13481" type="main" key="de_su^e_fi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sŭēfīo</orth>, v. desuefacio.</entryFree>
desuesco: <entryFree id="n13482" type="main" key="de_su^esco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sŭesco</orth>, <itype>sŭēvi, sŭētum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, or in post-Aug. prose; in Cic. and Caes. not at all; cf., however, desuefacio). <sense id="n13482.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to disuse, to lay aside a custom</hi> or <hi rend="ital">habit, to disaccustom, to put out of use</hi>: desuevi, ne quo ad cenam iret, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 95, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma diu desueta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 509</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rem desuetam usurpare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desueta sidera cerno (i. e. quae cernere desuevi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:503" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 503</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">voces jam mihi desuetae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:646" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 646</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desueta verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:7:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 7, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in desuescendis morari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:8:70" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 8, 70</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">desueto Samnite clamorem Romani exercitus pati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:38:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 38, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13482.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to become unaccustomed, to disaccustom one's self;</hi> or in the <hi rend="ital">perf., to be unaccustomed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">paullatim antiquo patrum honori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:576" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 576</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam desueta triumphis (i. e. bellis) agmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:815" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 815</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 693</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fera rabiem desueta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:231" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 231</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desueta corda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:722" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 722</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
desuetudo: <entryFree id="n13483" type="main" key="de_su^e_tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsŭētūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>desuesco</etym>, <sense id="n13483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">discontinuance of a practice</hi> or <hi rend="ital">habit, disuse, desuetude</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellandi, Fronto, princ. hist. p. 3, 7: desuetudine tardi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 436</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:7:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 5, 7, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:3:32 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 3, 32 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
desuetus: <entryFree id="n13484" type="main" key="de_su^e_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsŭētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from desuesco.</entryFree>
desugo: <entryFree id="n13485" type="main" key="de_su_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sūgo</orth>, no <sense id="n13485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ctum, 3, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to</hi> <cb n="DESU" /> <hi rend="ital">suck from</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">to suck in</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 37, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
desulco: <entryFree id="n13486" type="main" key="de_sulco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sulco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n13486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to furrow through, to plough up</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 1137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
desulto: <entryFree id="n13487" type="hapax" key="de_sulto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsulto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n13487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. intens. n.</hi> [desilio], <hi rend="ital">to leap down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mari,</quote> <trans><tr>into the sea</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
desultor: <entryFree id="n13488" type="main" key="de_sultor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsultor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leaper, vaulter</hi>, the technical designation of a sort of riders, who, in the circus-games, leaped from one horse to another without stopping. </sense><sense id="n13488.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:9" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 85</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13488.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a fickle, inconstant person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoris,</quote> <trans><tr>an inconstant lover</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 3, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">bellorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 1:section=8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 1, § 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
desultorius: <entryFree id="n13489" type="main" key="de_sulto_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsultōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>desultor</etym>. <sense id="n13489.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a vaulter</hi> (desultor): <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:39" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 88</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">desultorius</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:27:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 27, 57</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13489.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Desultory, superficial</hi>, Ap. M. 1, p. 102, 14.</sense></entryFree>
desultrix: <entryFree id="n13490" type="main" key="de_sultrix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsultrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inconstant</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">virtus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
desultura: <entryFree id="n13491" type="hapax" key="de_sultu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsultūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>desilio</etym>, <sense id="n13491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leaping</hi> or <hi rend="ital">jumping down</hi> from a horse; <cit><quote lang="la">comic, opp. insultura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
desum: <entryFree id="n13492" type="main" key="de_sum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sum</orth>, <itype>fŭi, esse</itype> (ee in deest, deesse, deerit, etc., in the poets <sense id="n13492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">per synaeresin</hi> as one syll., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 151</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 233</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 262</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 378</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 354</bibl> et saep.; <hi rend="ital">praes. subj.</hi>, desiet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:8" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 8</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, defuerunt, trisyl., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:585" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 585</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">fut. inf.</hi>, commonly defuturum esse, as <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 1, 2</bibl>, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">also defore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:248" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 248</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">imperf. subj.</hi>, deforent, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Hexaem. 3, 13</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. n., to be away, be absent; to fail, be wanting</hi> (for syn. cf.: absum, deficio, descisco, negligo; freq. in all periods). </sense><sense id="n13492.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n13492.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ratio, verum argentum deerat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 2, 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigore enim desunt ignes ventique calore Deficiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:360" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 360</bibl></cit>: cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:455" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 455</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:8" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia deerant, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper paullum ad summam felicitatem defuisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 43, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi numquam causas seditionum et certaminis defore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod non desit habentem, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 52</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">non desunt qui, for sunt qui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:85" default="NO">8, 3, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 109, 112, § 248</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13492.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>dat.</case> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">metuo mihi in monendo ne defuerit oratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Bac. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit> and 4: <cit><quote lang="la">cui nihil desit, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:14:51" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 14, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sive deest naturae quippiam, sive abundat atque affluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:29:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 29, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum alteri sententiae deesset animi, tantum alteri superesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 31</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">opp. superesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 63</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">opp. superare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neu desint epulis rosae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:36:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 36, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 58</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc unum ad pristinam fortunam Caesari defuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 26 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 96, 2</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n13492.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut neque in Antonio deesset hic ornatus orationis, neque in Crasso redundaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in C. Laenio commendando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:63 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 63 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n13492.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">et mihi non desunt turpes pendere corollae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:10" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 1 al.</bibl>—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">quominus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">duas sibi res, quominus in vulgus et in foro diceret, defuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 262, 23</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 39</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil contumeliarum defuit, quin subiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 45</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non defuit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Gord. III. 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13492.6" n="II" level="1"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to fail, be wanting in one's duty</hi>, as in rendering assistance, etc.; <hi rend="ital">not to assist</hi> or <hi rend="ital">serve, to desert</hi> one, <hi rend="ital">to neglect</hi> a person or thing. </sense><sense id="n13492.7" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum enitor, ut neque amicis neque etiam alienioribus opera, consilio, labore desim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne tibi desis,</quote> <trans><tr>that you be not wanting to yourself, neglect not your own advantage</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:36:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 36, 104</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 2</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 4, 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatu reique publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:1:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 1, 3 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">communi saluti nulla in re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Timotheo de fama dimicanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timoth. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic rei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:93:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 93, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 41, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decori vestro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officio et dignitati meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 17, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">occasioni temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 79</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13492.8" n="(b)" level="5"> Without <cb n="DETE" /> <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non deest reipublicae consilium ... nos, nos, dico aperte, consules desumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui non deerat in causis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:34:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 34, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec deerat Ptolemaeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n13492.9" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To fall short of, miss, fail to obtain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quis desit gratiae Dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:12:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 12, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
desumo: <entryFree id="n13493" type="main" key="de_su_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sūmo</orth>, <itype>mpsi</itype> (msi), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <sense id="n13493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to take for one's self</hi> from a multitude or mass; hence, <hi rend="ital">to pick out, choose, select</hi> (syn. deligere); <hi rend="ital">to take upon one's self, undertake</hi> (rare, and perh. not ante-Aug.— <cit><quote lang="la">syn. suscipere): sibi consules asservandos desumunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:55:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 55, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi pugnas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 37</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">cursum certamenque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 20, 7</bibl></cit>: sibi vacuas Athenas, *<bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
desuo: <entryFree id="n13494" type="hapax" key="de_su^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sŭo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n13494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to fasten</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupam imbricibus ferreis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:21:3" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 21, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
desuper: <entryFree id="n13495" type="main" key="de_su^per"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sŭper</orth>, <sense id="n13495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., from above, from overhead</hi> (repeatedly in the historians and poets; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): qui in phalangas insilirent et desuper vulnerarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:52:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 52, 5</bibl></cit> (a false reading in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:79:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 79, 2</bibl>; but v. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:511" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 511</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 16</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">aprum jaculis desuper petit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 72</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 74" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">desuper atrum nemus imminet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 165</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 47</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 122 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc desuper Alpis colles abripimur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:688" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 688</bibl></cit> (the construction as just before: feros Libyen; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 65</bibl>: sitientes ibimus Afros).—</sense><sense id="n13495.1" n="II" level="1"> Without the idea of motion, <hi rend="ital">above</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and late): <cit><quote lang="la">desuper extentas imposuere togas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:529" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 529</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:349" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 349</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:2:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:6:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:21:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 21, 7</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
desuperne: <entryFree id="n13496" type="main" key="de_superne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-supernē</orth>, <sense id="n13496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., from above</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10</bibl>. 16, 10 (dub. v. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:511" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 511</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
