desurgo: <entryFree id="n13497" type="main" key="de_surgo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-surgo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n13497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to rise from</hi> any place; <hi rend="ital">to rise</hi> (extremely rare). </sense><sense id="n13497.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: certa desurgere parte, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:703" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 703</bibl>: cenă, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 77</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13497.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to go to stool</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 140" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 140</bibl> and 142; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 14, 59, § 211</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
desurrectio: <entryFree id="n13498" type="main" key="de_surrecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēsurrectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>desurgo</etym>, <sense id="n13498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a going to stool</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 37" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:142" default="NO">142</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
desursum: <entryFree id="n13499" type="main" key="de_sursum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-sursum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> ( = desuper), <sense id="n13499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">from above</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> de Praescr. 46 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">descendens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Jacob, 3, 15 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
detectio: <entryFree id="n13500" type="main" key="de_tecti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētectĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>detego</etym>, <sense id="n13500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an uncovering;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">revealing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">creatoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
detector: <entryFree id="n13501" type="main" key="de_tector"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētector</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an uncoverer;</hi> trop., <hi rend="ital">revealer</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">creatoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 36 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conscientiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Val. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
detego: <entryFree id="n13502" type="main" key="de_te^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-tĕgo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to uncover, expose, lay bare</hi> (freq. in the Aug. per.). </sense><sense id="n13502.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus detexit villam,</quote> <trans><tr>unroofed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedem Junonis ad partem dimidiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regiam Caci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juga montium detexerat nebula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 7</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">capite detecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 57</bibl></cit>; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf. and in Gr. construction: <cit><quote lang="la">caput puer detectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 169</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ensem strictum vagina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:168" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 168</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plagam (opp. celare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 11</bibl></cit> et saep.: patefacta et detecta corpora, *<bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 38, 122</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13502.2" n="B" level="2"> In comic transf., <hi rend="ital">to take off, remove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">detegetur corium de tergo meo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec illa est tempestas mea, mihi quae modestiam omnem Detexit, tectus qua fui (the figure being taken from buildings),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13502.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to discover, disclose, reveal, betray, detect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis detegendo cladem nudandoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8</bibl></cit> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">20: animi secreta (with proferre mores),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latentem culpam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:546" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 546</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">mores se inter ludendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formidine detegi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 81</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
detendo: <entryFree id="n13503" type="main" key="de_tendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-tendo</orth>, no <sense id="n13503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, sum, 3, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to unstretch, relax</hi> a thing strained (very rare): tabernacula, <hi rend="ital">to strike the tents</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:85:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 85, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
detensus: <entryFree id="n13504" type="main" key="de_tensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from detendo.</entryFree>
detentator: <entryFree id="n13505" type="main" key="de_tenta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētentātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>detento</etym>, <sense id="n13505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who holds</hi> or <hi rend="ital">keeps back</hi> something, <hi rend="ital">a detainer</hi>, Cod. 7, 39, 7; 11, 59, 2.</sense></entryFree>
detentio: <entryFree id="n13506" type="main" key="de_tenti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētentĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>detineo</etym>, <sense id="n13506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a keeping back, detaining</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:6:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:1:5" default="NO">25, 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 24, 16</bibl>. <pb n="562" /> <cb n="DETE" /></sense></entryFree>
detento: <entryFree id="n13507" type="main" key="de_tento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētento</orth>, no <sense id="n13507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum, 1, <hi rend="ital">v. intens. a.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to hold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">keep back, to detain</hi> (late Lat.), Ven. Carm. 11, 21: servos, Cod. Th. 7, 13, 16 al.</sense></entryFree>
detentor: <entryFree id="n13508" type="main" key="de_tentor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētentor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who holds</hi> or <hi rend="ital">keeps back, a detainer</hi>: possessionis alienae, Cod. 8, 4, 10.</sense></entryFree>
detentus: <entryFree id="n13509" type="main" key="de_tentus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from detineo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n13510" type="hapax" key="de_tentus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētentus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>detineo</etym>, <sense id="n13510.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a holding</hi> or <hi rend="ital">keeping back</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
detepesco: <entryFree id="n13511" type="hapax" key="de_te^pesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-tĕpesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n13511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n., to cease to be lukewarm, to grow cool</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
detergeo: <entryFree id="n13512" type="main" key="de_terge^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-tergĕo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 2</itype> (also post-class.: <sense id="n13512.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">detergis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 191</bibl></cit>: detergunt, id. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 2, 375</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">detergantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12:section=21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 12, § 21</bibl></cit>; Ap. Mag. 59, p. 312, 26; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 47:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 47, 4</bibl>, v. tergeo), <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n13512.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To wipe off, wipe away</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n13512.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudorem frontis brachio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas pollice,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:746" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 746</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">teneros fletus stamine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 2, 375</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">araneas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12:section=21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 12, § 21</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubila,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to drive away, remove</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 7, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. sidera, <hi rend="ital">to drive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chase away</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=246" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 246</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13512.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cleanse by wiping, to wipe off, wipe clean, to clean out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput pallio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labra spongiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:9:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 9, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se linguā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:6:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontem unguento,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 47, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">falces fibrina pelle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 28, 47, § 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cloacas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 18</bibl>.—Comic: <cit><quote lang="la">mensam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to clear, to empty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13512.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13512.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To take away, remove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:10:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: somnum, Claud. Epith. Pall. et Cel. 27.—</sense><sense id="n13512.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To cleanse, purge</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum helleboro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 88, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">secula foedo victu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 1, 191</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13512.7" n="3" level="3"> In colloq. lang., of money: <cit><quote lang="la">primo anno LXXX. detersimus,</quote> <trans><tr>have swept off, got</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 10, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13512.8" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To strip off, break off; to break to pieces</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">remos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pinnas asseribus falcatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:27" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
deteriae: <entryFree id="n13513" type="gloss" key="de_te^ri^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētĕrĭae</orth> <itype>porcae id est macilentae</itype>, <sense id="n13513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lean</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=73:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 73, 5</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
deterior: <entryFree id="n13514" type="main" key="de_te^ri^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētĕrĭor</orth>, <itype>ius</itype>, <sense id="n13514.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. comp.</hi> (<hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> deterrimus, a um) [from an obs. <hi rend="ital">adj. deter</hi>, from <hi rend="ital">de</hi>, down; hence, lower, inferior, worse], <hi rend="ital">worse, poorer, meaner</hi> (freq. and class.—for syn. cf.: malus, injustus, improbus; pravus, nequam, corruptus, perversus; and the <hi rend="ital">compp.</hi> pejor, etc.). </sense><sense id="n13514.1" n="I" level="1"> Of inanimate things: seges, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ruina rem non fecit deteriorem, haud scio an jam fructuosiorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: so, vectigalia, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:36:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 36, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">muraena carne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deterior ac decolor aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:326" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 326</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1275</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 54</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">video meliora proboque, Deteriora sequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta aucta in deterius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 13 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus reipublicae ex bono in deterrimum conversum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 26</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">genus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 16, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitare optima simul et deterrima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13514.2" n="II" level="1"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">quo deteriores anteponantur bonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 39</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. melior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:21 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 21 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. optimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 27</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. strenuior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vidi ego nequam homines, verum te neminem deteriorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Bac. 5, 2, 61</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">peditatu erat deterior,</quote> <trans><tr>weaker</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">infideli deterior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,015:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Tim. 5, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo deterrime et impudentissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:33:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 33, 81</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">dēterius</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., worse, less</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de male Graecis Latine scripta deterius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nequi deterius huic sit quam quoi pessumest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 80</bibl></cit>: valeo, Luccei. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">olet herba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spe nostra si placeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 10, 90</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deterioro: <entryFree id="n13515" type="main" key="de_te^ri^o_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētĕrĭōro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>deterior</etym>, <sense id="n13515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make worse, to deteriorate</hi> (late Lat.), Claud. Mam. de Statu an. 1, 3 al.</sense></entryFree>
deterius: <entryFree id="n13516" type="main" key="de_te^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētĕrĭus</orth>, <sense id="n13516.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., worse</hi>, v. deterior <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
determinabilis: <entryFree id="n13517" type="main" key="de_termi^na_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētermĭnābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>determino</etym>, <sense id="n13517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has an end, finite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">materia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Herm. 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
determinatio: <entryFree id="n13518" type="main" key="de_termi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētermĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a boundary, conclusion, end</hi>: extrema ora et d. <cb n="DETE" /> mundi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:40:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 40, 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitus et determinatio orationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:52:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 52, 98</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
determinator: <entryFree id="n13519" type="hapax" key="de_termi^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētermĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who prescribes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">determines</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplinae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
determino: <entryFree id="n13520" type="main" key="de_termi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-termĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to enclose within boundaries, to bound; to limit, prescribe, determine</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n13520.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">regiones, limites, confinia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">augur regiones ab oriente ad occasum determinavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Asiam ab oriente Armenia minore, ab occidente Phrygia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 28, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imaginem templi scipione in solo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 2, 4, § 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13520.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to fix, settle, determine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">teli ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:403" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 403</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">segetes in diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 25, 39, § 77</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">diem jejuniis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Psych. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatoria et equestria officia biennio spatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod dicit spiritu, non arte determinat,</quote> <trans><tr>measures</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:44:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 44, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium determinat causas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:26:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 26, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensuram (Ponti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 24, § 77</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia fixa tuus glomerans determinat annus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Poet. Div. 1, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
detero: <entryFree id="n13521" type="main" key="de_te^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-tĕro</orth>, <itype>trīvi, trītum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to rub away, to wear away, to wear out</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; not in Cic. or Caes.). </sense><sense id="n13521.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">strataque jam volgi pedibus detrita viarum saxea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a catena collum detritum cani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 7, 16</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vestem usu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 73, § 191</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">detrita tegmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum usu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes (viă longă),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:16" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta,</quote> <trans><tr>to thresh out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:23" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">milium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:12:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scillam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:27:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 27, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telephion,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 13, 110, § 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calces deteris,</quote> <trans><tr>you tread on my heels</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 111</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13521.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to diminish in force, to lessen, weaken, impair</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudes Caesaris culpă ingeni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid velut usu ipso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid ardoris ac ferociae miles habuit, deteritur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 76 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab alio genere vitae detriti jam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:30:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum detritum est famae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:247" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">detrita bellis Suessa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:399" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 399</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">detereret sibi multa Lucilius,</quote> <trans><tr>would polish his verses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 69</bibl></cit> (cf. just before, v. 65, limatior).—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimia cura deterit magis quam emendat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">dētrītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., worn out, trite, hackneyed</hi> (for which in Cic. contritus): <cit><quote lang="la">illa in agendis causis jam detrita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:51" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deterreo: <entryFree id="n13522" type="main" key="de_terre^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-terrĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n13522.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To frighten from</hi> any thing; <hi rend="ital">to deter, discourage from, prevent, hinder</hi> (class.).—Constr. </sense><sense id="n13522.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">(Aliquem) ab aliqua re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines adolescentes a dicendi studio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:25:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 25, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanos homines a scribendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=75" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 75 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te a dimicatione (opp. ad certam laudem adhortor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum ab instituto consilio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">a proposito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:100:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 100, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos a cupiditate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferociores annos a licentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.— Without <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a turpi meretricis amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 112</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13522.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">(Aliquem) de aliqua re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de agro hunc senem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stoicos de sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:39:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 39, 81</bibl></cit>: me de statu meo, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13522.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">(Aliquem) ne, quin, quominus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(poetam) maledictis, ne scribat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. prol. 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 4, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 31, 16 al.</bibl> (but different is <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 47</bibl>: deterritum putant, ne discerperetur). —Without <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud ferro deterrere potes, ne me amet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 37</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">quin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin loquar haec ... numquam me potes deterrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 1, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 3</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Pass.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:13" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 13</bibl>; cf.: me homo nemo deterruerit, quin ea sit in his aedibus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">shall make me believe but that</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 61</bibl>.— With <hi rend="ital">quominus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque te deterreo, quominus id disputes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:48 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 48 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13522.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">aliquem</hi> and an <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (very rarely): <cit><quote lang="la">nefarias ejus libidines commemorare pudore deterreor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 9, 24</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <hi rend="ital">Aliquem aliqua re</hi> (very rarely): <cit><quote lang="la">silvestres homines caedibus et victu foedo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 392</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 98:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 98, 5</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquos magnitudine poenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavidam ense (with repellere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:296" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deterritis tribunis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar coercendum atque deterrendum Dumnorigem statuebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 7</bibl></cit>: in deterrenda<cb n="DETE" />  liberalitate, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:18:63" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 18, 63</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">advorsor sedulo et deterreo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 4, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:70 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 70 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13522.5" n="II" level="1"> In Augustan authors, sometimes with an inanimate object, like defendere, prohibere, etc., <hi rend="ital">to avert, keep off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vim a censoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 24 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">d. nefas et inhibere bipennem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:767" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 767</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
detersio: <entryFree id="n13523" type="main" key="de_tersi^o_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētersĭō</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>detergeo</etym>, <sense id="n13523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cleansing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:14:203" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 14, 203</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
detersus: <entryFree id="n13524" type="main" key="de_tersus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētersus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from detergeo.</entryFree>
detestabilis: <entryFree id="n13525" type="main" key="de_testa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētestābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>detestor</etym>, <sense id="n13525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">execrable, abominable, detestable</hi> (good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">omen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">exsecratus populo Romano, detestabilis, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 26</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil esse tam detestabile tamque pestiferum quam voluptatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 12, 41</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">res (with tetra, misera),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:8:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 8, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 10</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 17, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:19:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 19, 13</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> appears not to occur.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dētestābĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">abominably</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod nefarie, quod detestabiliter fecit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 10, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
detestatio: <entryFree id="n13526" type="main" key="de_testa_ti^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētestātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n13526.0" n="I" level="1"> In relig. lang. </sense><sense id="n13526.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Execration, cursing, detestation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:89" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 117" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 117 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:6:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 9, 11</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n13526.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A keeping off, averting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 40, § 135</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:55:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 55, 140</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13526.3" n="II" level="1"> In judicial lang., <hi rend="ital">a formal renunciation under oath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">detestatio est denuntiatio facta cum testatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:40" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. detestor, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.—So detestatio sacrorum, <hi rend="ital">the solemn renunciation of the family sacred rites, and thereby of the</hi> gens <hi rend="ital">itself, which in</hi> arrogatio <hi rend="ital">was made by the son</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:27:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 27, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Liber (Servii Sulpicii) de sacris detestandis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:12:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n13527" type="hapax" key="de_testa_ti^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-testātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. testis</etym>, <sense id="n13527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the removal of the testes, castration</hi>, Ap. M. 7, p. 198, 7.</sense></entryFree>
detestator: <entryFree id="n13528" type="main" key="de_testa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētestātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>detestor, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I.</etym>, <sense id="n13528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who execrates, a curser</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 27 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
detesto: <entryFree id="n13529" type="main" key="de_testo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētesto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym><hi rend="ital">act. collat.</hi> form of detestor</etym>, <sense id="n13529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to execrate</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">detestabant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 26, 6, 17</bibl></cit>; v. also detestor <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
detestor: <entryFree id="n13530" type="main" key="de_testor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-testor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n13530.1" n="I" level="1"> In relig. lang. </sense><sense id="n13530.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To curse while calling a deity to witness</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to execrate, abominate</hi> (for syn. cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">abominari, adversari, abhorrere, horrere, devovere, execrari): cum (te) viderunt, tamquam auspicium malum detestantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:16:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 16, 39</bibl></cit>: omnibus precibus detestatus Ambiorigem, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caput euntis hostili prece,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 505</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dira exsecratio ac furiale carmen detestandae familiae stirpique compositum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exitum belli civilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13530.3" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To call to witness</hi>, = testor, obtestor: <cit><quote lang="la">summum Jovem, deosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 60</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n13530.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To call down upon, denounce</hi> while invoking a deity: <cit><quote lang="la">minas periculaque in caput eorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum iram in caput infelicis pueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:20:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 20, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n13530.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To hate intensely, detest, abominate, abhor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam auctoremque cladis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 35 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civilia arma adeo detestari,</quote> <trans><tr>felt such abhorrence for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sortem populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 3</bibl></cit>: viam pravam <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 3, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13530.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to avert from one's self by entreaty, to ward off, avert, remove</hi>, sc. an evil from one's self or others, = deprecari, <hi rend="ital">to deprecate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut a me quandam prope justam patriae querimoniam detester ac deprecer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam consulatus tui a republica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:40:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 40, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:44:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 44, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o di immortales, avertite ac detestamini hoc omen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:4:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 4, 4, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13530.7" n="III" level="1"> In judic. lang., <hi rend="ital">to renounce solemnly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">under oath</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">detestatum est testatione denuntiatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:238" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 238</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ib. § 40, and detestatio, II.: Servius Sulpicius in libro de sacris detestandis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:12:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 12, 1</bibl></cit>.!*? In a pass. sense, Ap. Mag. p. 307, 24; <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Ep. ad Macr. 255</bibl>.—Esp., in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf., detested, abominated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">detestata omnia ejusmodi repudianda sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:11:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bella matribus detestata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
detexo: <entryFree id="n13531" type="main" key="de_texo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-texo</orth>, <itype>xŭi, xtum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to weave off, to finish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">make by weaving, to weave, plait</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n13531.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: inter decem <pb n="563" /> <cb n="DETO" /> annos unam togam, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 406, 19</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad detexundam telam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestimentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:70:section=11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 1, 70, § 11</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Comic.: pallium (qs. to take it from the loom),</quote> <trans><tr>to steal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid viminibus mollique junco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 72</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">fiscellam vimine junci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:15" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 15</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n13531.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to explain, describe, complete, finish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(lacteus) non perpetuum detexens conficit orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=250" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 250</bibl></cit>: te ab summo jam detexam exordio, Poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 27, 42</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ante exorsa et potius detexta prope retexantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 38, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at modo coeptum detexatur opus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Edyll. 10, 411</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
detextus: <entryFree id="n13532" type="main" key="de_textus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētextus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from detexo.</entryFree>
detineo: <entryFree id="n13533" type="main" key="de_ti^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-tĭnĕo</orth>, <itype>tĭnŭi, tentum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>teneo</etym>, <sense id="n13533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to hold off, keep back, detain</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13533.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nos de nostro negotio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ab aliquo incepto studioque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem apud villam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: so, <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 49</bibl>; Lentul. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 5, 5</bibl> (with demorari), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 17, 3</bibl> Oud. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 55</bibl> (opp. concire); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:788" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 788</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me grata compede Myrtale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:33:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Od. 1, 33, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:301" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 301</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">novissimos proelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:75:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 75, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibalem quam acerrimo bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se miserandis alimentis detinuerat,</quote> <trans><tr>had supported himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves tempestatibus detinebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rates voce canora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 311</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter iratae anguis (cantus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:20" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum ne discederet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 4, 42</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n13533.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13533.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <hi rend="ital">to delay</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">lengthen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">euntem multa loquendo Detinuit sermone diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 683</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pont. 4, 10, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13533.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to occupy, engage</hi> (also class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in alienis negotiis detineri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:45:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 45, 132</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in contumelia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in admiratione sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus in lyricis modis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:386" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 386</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentes hominum circa alia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:H. N. 14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> H. N. 14</bibl></cit> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">4: animum studiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:7:39" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 7, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos (mea poëmata),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:520" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 520</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:63" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos in timore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Afr. 72:3" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Afr. 72, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13533.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To hold</hi> in the mind, <hi rend="ital">know</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">veritatem Dei in injustitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Rom. 1, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
detondeo: <entryFree id="n13534" type="main" key="de_tonde^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-tondĕo</orth>, <itype>tŏtondi and tondi, tonsum, 2</itype> (detotonderat, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 868</bibl> P.; <sense id="n13534.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">opp. detondit, Enn. ib.: detonderis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:96:1" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 96, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:4:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 4, 7</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. a., to shear off, cut off, to clip, shear</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13534.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">oves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:96:1" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 96, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:28" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 28</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Bac. 5, 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgulta (for which, shortly before, deputare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:23" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:229" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 229</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">detonsa juventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:54" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">detonsi manni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 8, 15.—</sense><sense id="n13534.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">detonsae frigore frondes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>stripped off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:237" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 237</bibl></cit>: deque totondit agros laetos, i. e. <hi rend="ital">lays waste</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 868</bibl> P. (An. v. 487 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">salices haedi, gramina vaccae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>crop, eat</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Ecl. 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
detono: <entryFree id="n13535" type="main" key="de_to^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-tŏno</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <sense id="n13535.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To thunder down, to thunder</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13535.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">hic (sc. Juppiter) ubi detonuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:35" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13535.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to thunder forth, express in thundertones, to storm</hi> (freq. in Florus): <cit><quote lang="la">captis superioribus jugis in subjectos detonuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:17:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 17, 5</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of Hannibal's invasion of Italy,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:10 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 6, 10 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus epistolam meam turba patricia detonabit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ubi detonuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:202" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 202</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of lofty poetry,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Silv. 2, 7, 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13535.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To cease thundering;</hi> so only trop., <hi rend="ital">to cease raging</hi>: Aeneas nubem belli, dum detonet omnis, sustinet, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:809" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 809</bibl> (bellantum impetum sustinet, donec deferveat, Serv.): <cit><quote lang="la">ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:294" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 294</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi vitiosa jactatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
detonsio: <entryFree id="n13536" type="main" key="de_tonsi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētonsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>detondeo</etym>, <sense id="n13536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shearing off</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
detonso: <entryFree id="n13537" type="hapax" key="de_tonso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētonso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n13537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. intens. a.</hi> [detondeo], <hi rend="ital">to shear off</hi>: capillum, Fab. Pict. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:15:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 15, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
detonsus: <entryFree id="n13538" type="main" key="de_tonsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētonsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from detondeo.</entryFree>
detorno: <entryFree id="n13539" type="main" key="de_torno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-torno</orth>, no <sense id="n13539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum, 1, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to turn off</hi> with a lathe, <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n13539.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">anulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 9, 18, § 62</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n13539.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:8:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
detorqueo: <entryFree id="n13540" type="main" key="de_torque^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-torquĕo</orth>, <itype>si, tum</itype> (detorsum, <sense id="n13540.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr> <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 1. A. 2.), <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n13540.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to turn</hi> or <cb n="DETR" /> <hi rend="ital">bend aside, to turn off, turn away</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n13540.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n13540.3" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ponticulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 20, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornua (antennarum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:832" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 832</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habenas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 765</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen ab illā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 515</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:746" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 746</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13540.4" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc., to turn</hi> in any direction, <hi rend="ital">to direct towards</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(orbis partem) a latere in dextram partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">caudam in dexterum, in laevum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 51, 77, § 207</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proram ad undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus ad regem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 196</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervicem ad oscula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:12:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 2, 12, 25</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13540.5" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptates animos a virtute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:10:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 10, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (sc. voluntas testium) nullo negotio flecti ac detorqueri potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 17</bibl>.—Of etymolog. derivation: Marrucini vocantur, de Marso detorsum nomen, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 871</bibl> P.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">parce detorta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 53</bibl></cit>.—With indication of the term. ad quem: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad segnitiem luxumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:82:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 82, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vividum animum in alia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">te pravum alio (i. e. ad aliud vitium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 55</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n13540.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">twist out of shape, to distort</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13540.7" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes corporis detortae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:5:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vatinius corpore detorto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13540.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to distort, misrepresent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calumniando omnia detorquendoque suspecta efficere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">recte facta (with carpere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sincera rectaque ingenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:70:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 70, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum aliquod in pejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 13 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">verba, voltus in crimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermonem in obscenum intellectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 44</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n13540.9" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to turn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">go</hi> in any direction: <cit><quote lang="la">in laevam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 27, § 93</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
detorreo: <entryFree id="n13541" type="main" key="de_torre^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-torrĕo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <sense id="n13541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to scorch, to burn</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">me flamma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
detorsus: <entryFree id="n13542" type="main" key="de_torsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētorsus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">dētortus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from detorqueo.</entryFree>
detractatio: <entryFree id="n13543" type="main" key="de_tracta_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētractātio</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">dētractātor</orth>, v. detrect.</entryFree>
detractatus: <entryFree id="n13544" type="hapax" key="de_tracta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-tractātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n13544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a treatise</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
detractio: <entryFree id="n13545" type="main" key="de_tracti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētractĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>detraho</etym>, <sense id="n13545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drawing off, taking away, withdrawal</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13545.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">alieni, opp. appetitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doloris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 33, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <trans><tr>departure from</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 26, 39, § 246</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa ipsa (sc. Praxitelia capita) efficiuntur detractione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:21:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 21, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13545.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n13545.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="dom">Medic. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a purging</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 6</bibl></cit>.—More freq. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 101" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 101</bibl> et saep.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 44, 92, § 244</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:133" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 25, 64, § 133</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n13545.4" n="B" level="2"> Rhet. t. t., <hi rend="ital">a taking away, leaving out, ellipsis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:37 al" default="NO">9, 2, 37 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13545.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Detraction, slander, evil-speaking</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 1, 11</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:12:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2 Cor. 12, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
detracto: <entryFree id="n13546" type="main" key="de_tracto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētracto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. detrecto.</entryFree>
detractor: <entryFree id="n13547" type="main" key="de_tractor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētractor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>detraho, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n13547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disparager, detractor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (for which, detrectator laudum suarum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">abominatio hominum detractor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:24:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 24, 9 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
detractorius: <entryFree id="n13548" type="main" key="de_tracto_rius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētractōrius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>detractor</etym>, <sense id="n13548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disparaging, slanderous.—Plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: inflammat linguae mobilitas ... ad detractoria, (Pseud.) <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> ad Frat. Erem. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
detractus: <entryFree id="n13549" type="main" key="de_tractus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from detraho.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n13550" type="hapax" key="de_tractus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētractus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>detraho</etym>, <sense id="n13550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a taking away, rejection</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllabae (opp. adjectio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Suas. 7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Suas. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
detraho: <entryFree id="n13551" type="main" key="de_tra^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-trăho</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n13551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. perf. sync.</hi> detraxe, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 3, 15</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. a., to draw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">take off, draw away, draw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">take down; to pull down; to take away, remove, withdraw</hi> (class. and very freq.). </sense><sense id="n13551.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13551.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n13551.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">de</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> with <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">crumenam sibi de collo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 3, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">anulum de digito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 1, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de curru,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ex cruce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">stramenta e mulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 45, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines ex provinciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicum ex Gallia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibalem ex Italia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 20</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem pedibus e tribunali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Rhet. 6</bibl></cit> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n13551.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nudo vestimenta detrahere me jubes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui anulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amiculum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:34:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 34, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torquem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loricam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 260</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cb n="DETR" /> tegumenta scutis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
