G. 2, 21, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frenos equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 33</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">virum equo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 47</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in transvehendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 38</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n13551.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> alone: vestimenta, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:17" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veste detracta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:75:262" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 75, 262</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soccos detrahunt (servi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">detractis insignibus imperatoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:96:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 96, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:75:262" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 75, 262</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">statuas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:8:12" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 8, 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n13551.6" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad, in</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">trans</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">castella trans Euphraten,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 17</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:8:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 8, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad accusationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:68:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 68, 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad aequum certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tauros ad terram cornibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: naves ad terram, Auct. B. Alex. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dominationem in carcerem et catenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:24:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 24, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13551.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n13551.8" n="1" level="3"> In medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">to purge</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 7, 28, § 48</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13551.9" n="2" level="3"> With the accessory idea of depriving or diminishing, <hi rend="ital">to remove, withdraw, take away</hi> a thing from any one; <hi rend="ital">to draw off, remove, take away</hi> from any thing. </sense><sense id="n13551.10" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">de</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ex</hi> with <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa de suis commodis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid de summa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:513" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 513</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:78:section=181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 78, § 181</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ex ea summa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 5</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil de vivo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex tertia acie singulas cohortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:89:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 89, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">detractis cohortibus duabus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13551.11" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ei eidem detraxisset Armeniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scuto militi detracto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coronam capiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 47</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilia illi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasces indigno (opp. deferre),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 34</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">pellem hostiae,</quote> <trans><tr>to flay</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Levit. 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13551.12" n="(g)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> with <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid ab homine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 6, 30</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n13551.13" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13551.14" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to pull down, to lower</hi> (very rarely): <cit><quote lang="la">regum majestatem ab summo fastigio ad medium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:45:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 45, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:23:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 23, 9</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n13551.15" n="B" level="2"> In partic. (acc. to <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. B. 2.), <hi rend="ital">to withdraw, take away, take; to lower in estimation, disparage, detract from</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13551.16" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">detractis de homine sensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:9:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 9, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquam de nostra benevolentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum sibi de facultate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 70 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">studiose de absentibus detrahendi causa, severe dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:37:134" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 37, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de ipso, qui scripsit, detrahi nihil volo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:29:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 29, 71</bibl></cit>: aliquid de aliquo, Caecin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de hoc senatu detrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 7, 20</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">de aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de se,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 5, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de rebus gestis alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum detraxit ex studio, tantum amisit ex gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:67:236" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 67, 236</bibl></cit>; cf. id. Div. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:15:49" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> 15, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:Fam. 1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 5</bibl>, a.—</sense><sense id="n13551.17" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil tibi detraxit senatus nisi, etc. (opp. dare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:ib. 1:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 5</bibl></cit>, b; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">opp. concedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:de Or. 2:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 71</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:71" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorem debitum ordini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam opinionem maerenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:31:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 31, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritatem Cottae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:5:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 17, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:4 al" default="NO">5, 7, 4 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">errorem animis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccles. 10, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13551.18" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid dicere detrahendae spoliandaeque dignitatis alicujus gratia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 2</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">laudis simulatione detrahitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:55" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 55</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 9, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13551.19" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To withhold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ususfructus in mancipanda proprietate detrahi potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:33" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
detrectatio: <entryFree id="n13552" type="main" key="de_trecta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētrectātĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dētract-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>detrecto</etym>, <sense id="n13552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a declining, refusing</hi> (very rare, and perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">militiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heredis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 7, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pat. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine detrectatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
detrectator: <entryFree id="n13553" type="main" key="de_trecta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētrectātor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dētract-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n13553.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who declines</hi> or <hi rend="ital">refuses</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ministerii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 117, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13553.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A diminisher, disparager</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudum suarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:15:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 15, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 2, 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
detrecto: <entryFree id="n13554" type="main" key="de_trecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-trecto</orth> (in the best MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-tracto</orth>), <itype>ăvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n13554.0" n="I" level="1"> Orig., <hi rend="ital">to decline, refuse, reject</hi> any thing; and hence, <hi rend="ital">to decline, refuse</hi> to do any thing (not in Cic.—for syn. cf.: nego, infitias eo, infitior, diffiteor, denego, recuso, abnuo, renuo, defugio). </sense><sense id="n13554.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: militiam, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 14, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 4:1:25" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 4, 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:43" default="NO">43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:22:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 22, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:36 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 36 al.</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:5:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:11:1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 11, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 39</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">officia sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicandi munus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 32</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">imperata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 54</bibl></cit>: <pb n="564" /> <cb n="DETR" /> dominationem, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 80</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">principem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patris jussa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincla pedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:38" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">juga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aratrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 3, 7, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13554.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">tutelam administrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:14:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 37, 14, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, p. 201</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13554.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:38:12" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 38, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 47</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n13554.4" n="II" level="1"> To pull down with violence; hence, trop. (cf. detraho, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. B.), <hi rend="ital">to lower in estimation, to depreciate, detract from</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">advorsae res etiam bonos detractant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquos oratores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:9 al" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 9 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ciceronis, Vergilii gloriam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium Homeri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 365</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maligne benefacta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:271" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 271</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: sibi primo, mox omnibus detrectaturus, Suet. Vit. Pers. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de vobis tamquam de malefactoribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl></cit> Pet. 2, 12.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:337" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 337</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
detrimentosus: <entryFree id="n13555" type="hapax" key="de_tri_mento_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētrīmentōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>detrimentum</etym>, <sense id="n13555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hurtful, detrimental</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hoste discedere detrimentosum esse existimabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
detrimentum: <entryFree id="n13556" type="main" key="de_tri_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētrīmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>detero</etym>, <sense id="n13556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rubbing off</hi>. * </sense><sense id="n13556.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: limae tenuantis, Ap. M. 6, p. 175, 25.—</sense><sense id="n13556.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">loss, damage, detriment</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13556.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (class.; cf. for syn.: damnum, jactura, incommodum, dispendium): emolumenta et detrimenta (quae <foreign lang="greek">w)felh/mata</foreign> et <foreign lang="greek">bla/mmata</foreign> appellant) communia esse voluerunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 21</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=176" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 176</bibl> Müll.; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. emolumentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostro incommodo detrimentoque doleamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:1:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">afferre,</quote> <trans><tr>to occasion, cause</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:82:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 82, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 2, 3</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">magna inferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">importare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 9, 38</bibl></cit>: accipere, <hi rend="ital">to suffer</hi>, in gen., <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 12, 34</bibl>; esp. <hi rend="ital">to suffer defeat in battle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 22, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 53, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 1, 3</bibl> et saep.: capere, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 18, 2</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the foll., and facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cato 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cato 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 11" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 11 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acceptum sarcire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 45, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 67, 2</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">reconcinnare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 15</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in bonum vertere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 73</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>, et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">animae suae detrimentum pati,</quote> <trans><tr>loss, ruin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:16:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 16, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">detrimentum sui facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 9, 25</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n13556.4" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n13556.5" n="1" level="3"> In the well-known formula, by which unlimited power was intrusted to the consuls: <cit><quote lang="la">videant consules (dent magistratus operam, provideant, etc.), ne quid respublica detrimenti capiat (accipiat),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:26:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 26, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13556.6" n="2" level="3"> In the histt., <hi rend="ital">the loss of a battle, defeat, overthrow</hi> (cf. calamitas and incommodum, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 34, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 19, 4</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
detritus: <entryFree id="n13557" type="main" key="de_tri_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētrītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from detero.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n13558" type="main" key="de_tri_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētrītus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>detero</etym>, <sense id="n13558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a rubbing away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">detrimentum a detritu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:36:section=176" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 36, § 176</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
detriumpho: <entryFree id="n13559" type="main" key="de_tri^umpho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-trĭumpho</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to triumph over, to conquer</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">daemones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 27 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
detrudo: <entryFree id="n13560" type="main" key="de_tru_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-trūdo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to thrust, drive</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">force away; to thrust down, push down</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n13560.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13560.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">neminem statui detrusum, qui non adhibita vi manu demotus et actus praeceps intellegatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:17:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 17, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui advorsum eunt, aspellito, Detrude, deturba in viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquos ad molas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 3, 33</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">d. et compingere in pistrinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in laevam partem oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quosdam contis remisque in mare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Cal. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedum digitos in terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stygias ad undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:773" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 773</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:43" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub inania Tartara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:523" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 523</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vi tempestatum Cythnum insulam detrusus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hucine nos ad senem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">istoc maleficos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves scopulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 145</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13560.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n13560.4" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to thrust</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drive away</hi> an enemy from his position; <hi rend="ital">to dislodge, dispossess</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:7" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Albani prensare, detrudere,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>from their horses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquoties detrusus (sc. de rostris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Hist. Fragm. 1:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Hist. Fragm. 1, 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 469</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 3 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13560.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: ex qua (arce) me nives, frigora, imbres detruserunt, Vatin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13560.6" n="2" level="3"> Jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to drive out</hi> a person<cb n="DEUC" />  from his possession, <hi rend="ital">to dispossess</hi> (cf. deduco, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. B., and deicio, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. B.): <cit><quote lang="la">quid ais? potestne detrudi quisquam, qui non attingitur? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quintius contra jus de saltu, agroque communi a servis communibus vi detruditur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n13560.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13560.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to drive</hi> from or to any thing; <hi rend="ital">to bring, reduce</hi> to any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de sua sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a primo ordine in secundum detrudi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut detrudendi Domitii causa consulatum peterent,</quote> <trans><tr>of defeating, keeping him out of office</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quanto regno ad quam fortunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,020:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timol. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ad mendicitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 3, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ea quae nostri ingenii non erunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad id, quod facere possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad necessitatem belli civilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tantum luctum et laborem detrusus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in paupertatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentiam in paucissimos sensus et angustas sententias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13560.9" n="B" level="2"> In partic. of time, <hi rend="ital">to put off, postpone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitia in mensem Martium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 13, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 17, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
detruncatio: <entryFree id="n13561" type="main" key="de_trunca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētruncātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>detrunco</etym>, <sense id="n13561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lopping off</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ramorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 9, 37, § 57</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 24, 37, § 237</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
detrunco: <entryFree id="n13562" type="main" key="de_trunco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-trunco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to lop</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cut off</hi> (rare, and perh. not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n13562.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">superiorem partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:13" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alam regi apium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 17, 17, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:770 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 770 al.</bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n13562.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to the body from which a member is cut off, <hi rend="ital">to mutilate, maim, behead</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladio detruncata corpora bracchiis abscisis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:145" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 145</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Dalmatas incensa urbe quasi detruncaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:11" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
detrusio: <entryFree id="n13563" type="main" key="de_tru_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētrūsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>detrudo</etym>, <sense id="n13563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thrusting down</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">in lacum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Isai. 8, 24, 22 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
detrusus: <entryFree id="n13564" type="main" key="de_tru_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētrūsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from detrudo.</entryFree>
detudes: <entryFree id="n13565" type="gloss" key="de_tu^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dētŭdes</orth>, <itype>detunsi, deminuti</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:73:11" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> 73, 11</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
detumesco: <entryFree id="n13566" type="main" key="de_tu^mesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-tŭmesco</orth>, <itype>mŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n., to cease swelling, to settle down, subside</hi> (postAug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">stagna lacusque sonori detumuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:259" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi maris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 468</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">odia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 109, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colla superbarum gentium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 8, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
detundo: <entryFree id="n13567" type="main" key="de_tundo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-tundo</orth>, no <sense id="n13567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, sum, 3, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to beat, bruise</hi> (very rare; perh. only in the foll. passages): guberna, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 490, 32</bibl> (dub. Gerl. detondete): digitos pedum ad lapides, Ap. M. 2, p. 128, 39.</sense></entryFree>
deturbo: <entryFree id="n13568" type="main" key="de_turbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-turbo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to drive, thrust</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">cast down, to throw</hi> or <hi rend="ital">beat down</hi>, sc. in a violent, tumultuous manner (freq. and class.; orig. perh. peculiar to milit. lang.). </sense><sense id="n13568.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de pugnaculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostros de vallo lapidibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:81:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 81, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ex vallo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:67:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 67, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Macedones ex praesidiis stationibusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; and so in a milit. sense with the simple <case>acc.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 13 al.</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de tecto tegulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Trebonium de tribunali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 21, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem certa re et possessione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 25, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fucos a sedibus suis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jun. 7</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">statuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:38:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 38, 93</bibl>; cf. aedificium, <hi rend="ital">to pull</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tear down</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 9, 7</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Phaëthonta equis in terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 402</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipitem ab alta puppi in mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 6</bibl>: caput orantis terrae, <hi rend="ital">to strike to the ground</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to cut off</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:555" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 555</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n13568.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (repeatedly in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">elsewhere rare): aliquem de sanitate ac mente,</quote> <trans><tr>to deprive of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:20:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 20, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ex magna spe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de fortunis omnibus P. Quinctius deturbandus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 14, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec verecundiam mi et virtutis modum deturbavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 60</bibl></cit>.— With <case>abl.</case> alone: <cit><quote lang="la">neque solum spe, sed certa re jam et possessione deturbatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 25, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:20:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 20, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deturpo: <entryFree id="n13569" type="main" key="de_turpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-turpo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n13569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to disfigure</hi> (postAug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">comatos occipitio raso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 35</bibl></cit>: poma rugis. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 16, 18, § 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 11, 4</bibl></cit> sq.</sense></entryFree>
deucalion: <entryFree id="n13570" type="main" key="Deuca^li^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Deucălĭon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*deukali/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n13570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son <cb n="DEUS" /> of Prometheus, king of Phthia, in Thessaly, and husband of Pyrrha</hi>. He is famous on account of the deluge sent in his days by Jupiter, and as the progenitor of a new race of men, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:318 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 318 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 153" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 153</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:62 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 62 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimiae Deucalionis aquae,</quote> <trans><tr>Deucalion's deluge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:794" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 794</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:32:53" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 32, 53</bibl> (3, 30, 53 M.).—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Deucălĭōnēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of Deucalion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">undae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imbres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:653" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 653</bibl></cit>: cautes, Col. <usg type="style">poet.</usg> 10, 67.</sense></entryFree>
deunx: <entryFree id="n13571" type="main" key="de^unx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕ-unx</orth>, <itype>uncis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>uncia</etym>, <sense id="n13571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eleven twelfths</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=172" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 172</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">jugeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heres ex deunce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avidi deunces,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>eleven per cent</tr>.,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:150" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 150</bibl></cit>: potare deunces, i. e. <hi rend="ital">eleven measures</hi> (cyathos), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:28" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 28</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deuro: <entryFree id="n13572" type="main" key="de^u_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕ-ūro</orth>, <itype>ussi, ustum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to burn up, consume</hi> (freq. in the historians; elsewh. rare; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n13572.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: pluteos turrium, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">agros vicosque (with depopulari),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partem Circi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montem Caelium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 40, 41</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13572.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of cold, <hi rend="ital">to destroy</hi> (cf.: aduro, amburo, and Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kai/ein</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">hiems arbores deusserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:9:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 9, 12</bibl>. And of destruction by a serpent's breath, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:25:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 25, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deus: <entryFree id="n13573" type="main" key="de^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype> (<sense id="n13573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">voc. sing.</hi> deus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:22:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 22, 3 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but, dee,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Hamart. 931</bibl>; cf. Prob. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> Art. 532, p. 340</bibl>. The <hi rend="ital">nom. plur.</hi> is di and dei; dii is freq. in MSS., but prob. indicates only the length of the ī. Di alone is found in Verg. and Hor.; di and dei indifferently in post-Aug. poets.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi>: deōrum and deum. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> also, divum or divom, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:10:65" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, 10, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 46</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:25 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 2, 25 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Dat.</hi>: dis or diis, usually monosyl.; and, deis, mostly postAug.; also, <cit><quote lang="la">DIBVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1307</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1676</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3091</bibl>; 3413; <cit><quote lang="la">and DIIBVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2118</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4608</bibl>.—As monosyllable, deus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 53</bibl>: deorum, dissyl. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 45</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">but dĭī,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 493</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dĕī,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:519" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 519</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dĕīs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:29" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 29</bibl></cit>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root in Sanscr.: dī, div- (dyu-), to gleam: dyāus (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">zeu/s</foreign>), heaven: dévas, God; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">dios, eu)di/a</foreign>; but not <foreign lang="greek">qeo/s</foreign>, Curt. Gr. etym. 503 sqq.</etym>. <hi rend="ital">a god, a deity</hi> (for syn. cf.: divus, numen). </sense><sense id="n13573.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:22 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 22 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:26:65 sq" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 26, 65 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 14</bibl>: qualem te patriae custodem di genuerunt, etc., Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 41</bibl> (Ann. v. 116 sq. ed Vahl.): ab Jove ceterisque dis deabusque immortalibus ... deorum immortalium numen, Cic. Rab. perd. 2, 5 et innum. al.—</sense><sense id="n13573.2" n="B" level="2"> Special combinations. </sense><sense id="n13573.3" n="1" level="3"> Forms of ejaculation: <cit><quote lang="la">di,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 1, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">di boni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 2, 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">di immortales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 299</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pro di immortales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 190</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">di magni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:187" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di deaeque, Plin. H. N. prooem. § 24: di vostram fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 190</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 5 al.</bibl> (for which in full: <cit><quote lang="la">di, obsecro vostram fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 78</bibl></cit>); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pro deum atque hominum fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:1:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 2, 1, 1 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and ellipt.: pro deum immortalium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 2, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13573.4" n="2" level="3"> Forms of wishing (well or ill), greeting, asseveration, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">di bene vortant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 10</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in the order: di vortant bene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utinam di faxint ut, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 109</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ita di deaeque faxint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di faciant, ut, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">di prohibeant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 36</bibl></cit>; cf.: di averruncent, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 2</bibl> A, 1; and: <cit><quote lang="la">quod di omen avertant,</quote> <trans><tr>the gods forbid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 14, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di melius faciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 81</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">di melius duint,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 5, 8, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di meliora ferant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:1" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">di meliora velint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 37</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also ellipt.: di meliora,</quote> <trans><tr>God forbid!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 14, 47</bibl>; Liv; 39, 10 et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">and di melius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 125</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 98" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 98 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dent tibi di multa bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 80</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 3, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:5:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 5, 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">di te servassint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 103</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">di me servatum volunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 3, 69</bibl> <pb n="565" /> <cb n="DEVE" /> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">di te perduint (perdant),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:10 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 10 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">di te eradicent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 28</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">di tibi male faciant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:21 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 21 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">di te ament (amabunt), as a form of greeting,</quote> <trans><tr>God bless you!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 4, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:6 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 2, 6 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita me di ament (amabunt),</quote> <trans><tr>so help me the gods!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 3, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 4, 44</bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ita me di bene ament,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 4, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 3, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per deos immortales,</quote> <trans><tr>by the immortal gods!</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:2 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 2 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum dis volentibus,</quote> <trans><tr>by the gods' help</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> in Cic. Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl></cit> (Ann. v. 207 ed. Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dis volentibus,</quote> <trans><tr>God willing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:3:14:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> 3, 14, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si dis placet,</quote> <trans><tr>if it please the gods</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 94</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: si di volent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 88</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">more freq.: si dis placet, ironically or contemptuously,</quote> <trans><tr>an't please the gods; if you please; forsooth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:32" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:4:1 al" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 4, 1 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">di hominesque,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>all the world, every body</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:19 al" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 19 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dis hominibusque invitis,</quote> <trans><tr>in spite of every body</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:16:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 16, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13573.5" n="C" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n13573.6" n="1" level="3"> In poets sometimes <hi rend="ital">a goddess;</hi> cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qeo/s</foreign>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducente deo (sc. Venere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 632</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audentes deus ipse juvat (sc. Fortuna),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:586" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 586</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Sat. 3, 8</bibl>; cf. of Aurora, Cat. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of Alecto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:498" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 498</bibl></cit> (but in all these passages, some regard deus as <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, = <foreign lang="greek">to\ qei=on</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the divinity</hi>, Heyne ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 632</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n13573.7" n="2" level="3"> Of Bacchus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:337" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 337</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 636</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13573.8" n="D" level="2"> In eccl. Lat., esp. the God of the Hebrews and Christians, <hi rend="ital">God</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deus summus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnipotens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 17, 1</bibl></cit> et passim. Also of <hi rend="ital">the Son of God, God the Son, Christ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deus pater et Deus filius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 29, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Johan. 1, 1 al.</bibl></sense><sense id="n13573.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of highly distinguished or fortunate persons: <cit><quote lang="la">te in dicendo semper putavi deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:23:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 1, 23, 106</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 42, 179</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facio te apud illum deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audiamus Platonem quasi quendam deum philosophorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">deus ille noster Plato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi nunc nobis deus ille magister, Eryx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 392</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos quoniam propius contingis (i. e. Augustus and Maecenas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus sum, si hoc ita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sum deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; esp. of great patrons or protectors, <hi rend="ital">a guardian god</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lentulus consul, parens deus, salus nostrae vitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> post Red. ad Quir. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lentulus, cujus pater deus ac parens nominis mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:69:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 69, 144</bibl></cit>.—Hence freq. in inscriptions and on coins of the period of the empire, as <hi rend="ital">an epithet of the emperors</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">DEO AUG.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 609</bibl></cit> et saep.; cf. Nem. Venat. 71; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:7" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deustus: <entryFree id="n13574" type="main" key="de^ustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from deuro.</entryFree>
deuterius: <entryFree id="n13575" type="greek" key="deute^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">deutĕrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">deute/rios</foreign>, <sense id="n13575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">secondary</hi> (pure Lat. secundarius): <cit><quote lang="la">vina ( = lora),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 10, 12, § 86</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deuteronomium: <entryFree id="n13576" type="greek" key="deute^ro^no^mi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">deutĕrŏnŏmĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">deuterono/mion</foreign>. <sense id="n13576.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A copy of the law</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:17:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 17, 18</bibl>; id. Josue, 8, 32.—</sense><sense id="n13576.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The fifth book of Moses, Deuteronomy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 17, 6 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
deutor: <entryFree id="n13577" type="hapax" key="de^u_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĕ-ūtor</orth>, <itype>ūti</itype>, <sense id="n13577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep., to use wrongfully, abuse;</hi> with <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">victo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 11, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
devagor: <entryFree id="n13578" type="main" key="de_va^gor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-văgor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n13578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n., to wander, to stray from</hi> (post-class.): a venditionibus, Cod. Th. 1, 10, 5.—</sense><sense id="n13578.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to deviate, digress</hi>: a venditionibus ulterius, Justin. de Conc. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
devastator: <entryFree id="n13579" type="main" key="de_vasta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvastātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n13579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who devastates</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 6, 45</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
devasto: <entryFree id="n13580" type="main" key="de_vasto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-vasto</orth>, no <sense id="n13580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ātum, 1, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to lay waste, devastate</hi> (rare, and perh. not anteAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">fines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marsos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmina ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 255</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13580.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:23:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 23, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ecclesiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Act. 8, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
devecto: <entryFree id="n13581" type="hapax" key="de_vecto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-vecto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n13581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. intens. a., to carry away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ligatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 5, 345</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deveho: <entryFree id="n13582" type="main" key="de_ve^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-vĕho</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to carry down, to carry, convey, take away</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13582.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">most freq. in the histt.): has (carinas) carris junctis devehit noctu milia passuum a castris XXII.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:54:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 54, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionem equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 43, 2</bibl></cit>: <cb n="DEVE" /> maximos commeatus (Tiberis), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">id simulacrum Syracusis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3</bibl></cit>: devecta cremato Sarmenta, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 408</bibl> et saep.—Designating the term. ad quem: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in Anactorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (frumentum) eo tolerandae hiemis causa devexerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 47, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tritici decies centum milia ad mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 43, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentum in Graeciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saucios in oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 33</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13582.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> in middle sense, <hi rend="ital">to go away, to go down, descend</hi>: Veliam devectus Brutum vidi, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tiberi devectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Rheno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arare flumine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Misenum usque devectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 72</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13582.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ad tua devehar astra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 119.</sense></entryFree>
devello: <entryFree id="n13583" type="main" key="de_vello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-vello</orth>, <itype>velli, vulsum</itype>, (<sense id="n13583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> devolsit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 5</bibl>), 3, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to pluck down, to pull</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tear off</hi> (very rare; not in Cic. and Caes.): pennas, Plaut, Poen. 4, 2, 50; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">plumam anseribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1248,001:Ep. ad Verr. 1" default="NO"><author>Fronto</author> Ep. ad Verr. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantas de matrum radice,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 10, 1</bibl></cit>: effigies (sc. in Tiberim; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 17</bibl>, and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:58" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 58</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 14</bibl>. In an obscene sense: <cit><quote lang="la">concubinas (i. e. depilare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
develo: <entryFree id="n13584" type="hapax" key="de_ve_lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-vēlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n13584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to unveil, uncover</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora sorori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:604" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 604</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deveneror: <entryFree id="n13585" type="main" key="de_ve^ne^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-vĕnĕror</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a., to reverence, worship</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n13585.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">deos prece,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13585.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnia ter sanctā deveneranda molā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to avert by prayers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:5:14" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
devenio: <entryFree id="n13586" type="main" key="de_ve^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-vĕnĭo</orth>, <itype>vēni, ventum, 4</itype>, <sense id="n13586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n.;</hi> orig., <hi rend="ital">to come from</hi> somewhere; hence, with predominant reference to the term. ad quem (cf. de, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. B.), <hi rend="ital">to go to, arrive at, reach</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n13586.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quomodo ad hunc devenerim In servitutem ab eo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quam quisque in partem ab opere casu devenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad alias aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 4, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad mare, id Poen. 3, 3, 14: ad legionem decimam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
