G. 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in insidias,</quote> <trans><tr>to fall</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 1, 92</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in victoris manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in loca nobis adversa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in eum locum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Scythiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:798" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 798</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: quo, *<bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 27</bibl> et saep. —</sense><sense id="n13586.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">devenere locos ubi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:365" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 365</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">locos laetos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 638</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speluncam eandem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 125</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">166: silvas et amoena piorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:84" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 84</bibl></cit>. Cf.: venio, pervenio, and 1. eo.—</sense><sense id="n13586.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in vulg. lang., like our <hi rend="ital">to come</hi>, instead of <hi rend="ital">to go to</hi> a place: <cit><quote lang="la">deveniam ad lenonem domum egomet solus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Epid. 3, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">post ad furem ego devenio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 53</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13586.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to reach, arrive at, come to</hi>: tantum devenisse ad eum mali, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad juris studium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 13, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 17, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">devenit aut potius incidit in istum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in medium rerum omnium certamen atque discrimen (coupled with incidere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alicujus tutelam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quos fines saeculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 10, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
devenusto: <entryFree id="n13587" type="main" key="de_ve^nusto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-vĕnusto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13587.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to disfigure, deform</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">pulchritudinis insignia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:8 al" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 8 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
deverbero: <entryFree id="n13588" type="main" key="de_verbe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-verbĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to thrash</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cudgel soundly</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">homines deverberasse usque ad necem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 2, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 7, 20</bibl></cit> (al. diverb.).</sense></entryFree>
devergentia: <entryFree id="n13589" type="main" key="de_vergenti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvergentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>devergo</etym>, <sense id="n13589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an inclining downwards, a sloping</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">d. et convexiones mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
devergo: <entryFree id="n13590" type="hapax" key="de_vergo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-vergo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n13590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to incline downwards, to sink</hi>, Ap. de Deo Socr. p. 46; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Exhort. Cast. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deverra: <entryFree id="n13591" type="gloss" key="De_verra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dēverra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>deverro</etym>, <sense id="n13591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of sweeping, that presided over the threshold of a house where a woman lay in child-bed, to protect her against Sylvanus</hi>, acc. to Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 6:9" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 6, 9</bibl>; cf. Voss. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Ecl. 10, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deverro: <entryFree id="n13592" type="main" key="de_verro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-verro</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dīv-</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n13592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to sweep away, sweep out</hi> (very rare): devorare omnia ac deverrere, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 420, 7</bibl>; Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Civ. D. 6:9" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Civ. D. 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:4:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 4, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deversito: <entryFree id="n13593" type="main" key="de_versi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēversĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n13593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. intens. n.</hi> [deverto], <hi rend="ital">to put up</hi> at an inn; <cit><quote lang="la">trop.: ad verborum venustates,</quote> <trans><tr>to dwell upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:20:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 20, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
deversitor: <entryFree id="n13594" type="main" key="de_versi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēversĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>deversor</etym>, <sense id="n13594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one</hi> <cb n="DEVE" /> <hi rend="ital">who puts up</hi> at an inn, <hi rend="ital">a guest</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 79, 6</bibl>, and 95, 1.</sense></entryFree>
deversor: <entryFree id="n13595" type="main" key="de_versor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-versor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vorsor</orth>), <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n., to be tarrying</hi> as a guest, <hi rend="ital">to lodge anywhere as a guest</hi> (rare but good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">cum Athenis apud eum deversarer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:8:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 8, 22</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">apud aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in domo aliqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">domi suae deversatum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:31:section=70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 31, § 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 8, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:9" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 9</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parum laute,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n13596" type="hapax" key="de_versor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-versor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>deverto</etym>, <sense id="n13596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who lodges</hi> anywhere, <hi rend="ital">an inmate, guest</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caupo cum quibusdam deversoribus illum consequitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:4:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit> (MSS. diversoribus, which Kayser restores).</sense></entryFree>
deversoriolum: <entryFree id="n13597" type="main" key="de_verso_ri^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēversōrĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>deversorium</etym>, <sense id="n13597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small lodging-place</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:14:8" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> 14, 8</bibl> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 72</bibl> dub.).</sense></entryFree>
deversorius: <entryFree id="n13598" type="main" key="de_verso_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēversōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">dīver-</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 51, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:2:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 2, 22</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>2. deversor</etym>, <sense id="n13598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to an inn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lodging-place, fit to lodge in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">taberna,</quote> <trans><tr>a lodging-place, lodging, inn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 3, 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 27</bibl>. In this sense also <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēversōrĭum</orth> (old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvors-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (for syn. cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">caupona, hospitium, taberna, popina, ganea),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 23, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:63" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:7 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 7 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiorum, non libidinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officina nequitiae et deversorium flagitiorum omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:46:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 46, 134</bibl></cit>.—Also in gen. for taberna: <cit><quote lang="la">monumentorum bustorumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:2:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 2, 7 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
deversus: <entryFree id="n13599" type="gloss" key="de_versus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēversus</orth>, i. e. deorsum versus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=71:1" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 71, 1</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
deverticulum: <entryFree id="n13600" type="main" key="de_verti^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvertĭcŭlum</orth> (many MSS. and some edd. <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvert-</orth>, old form <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvort-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>deverto</etym>. <sense id="n13600.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A by-road, by-path, side-way</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13600.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">quae deverticula flexionesque quaesivisti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 22, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:13:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 13, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 25, § 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fluminis,</quote> <trans><tr>a branch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41:3:45" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 41, 3, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:3:7" default="NO">44, 3, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13600.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a deviation, digression</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legentibus velut deverticula amoena quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:79" default="NO">9, 2, 79</bibl>: aquarum calidarum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a mode of cure</hi> (deviating from the simple one) <hi rend="ital">by the use of warm water</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">significationis,</quote> <trans><tr>derivation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 9</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">a deverticulo repetatur fabula,</quote> <trans><tr>from the digression</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:72" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per varia sectarum deverticula,</quote> <trans><tr>byways of doctrine</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13600.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A place for travellers to put up; an inn, a lodging</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13600.4" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum gladii abditi ex omnibus locis deverticuli protraherentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 51 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; also, <hi rend="ital">a resort for low characters</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupanaria et deverticula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 27</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n13600.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a refuge, retreat, lurking-place</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 39, 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:17:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 17, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:3:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 3, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 50, 71, § 140</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
deverto: <entryFree id="n13601" type="main" key="de_verto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-verto</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvorto</orth>, <itype>ti, sum</itype> (in MSS. often confounded with diverto), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <sense id="n13601.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n13601.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To turn away, turn aside</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">comites suo hortatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:317" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 317</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:470" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 470</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventura fata suo cursu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:591" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 591</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 38" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 38</bibl>.— Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n13601.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> with mid. force, <hi rend="ital">to turn one's self aside;</hi> and with esp. reference to the term. ad quem, <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">betake one's self to</hi> any place; <hi rend="ital">to turn in, put up at</hi> (in the latter sense esp. freq. in Plaut., whereas Cicero commonly uses the <hi rend="ital">act.</hi> form; v. under <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.). </sense><sense id="n13601.3" n="1" level="3"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">si qui Cobiamacho (vico) deverterentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvat ire jugis, qua nulla priorum Castaliam molli devertitur orbita clivo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 293</bibl></cit>: deverti ad amicos suos, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=234:26" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 234, 26</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">devortitur apud suum paternum hospitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 85</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 1, 10</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ib. § 7: ad me in hospitium maximum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Poen. 3:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 3, 60</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in amici hospitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Mil. 3:1:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 146</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Ps. 4:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc in tabernam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:ib. 2:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intro domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Stich. 4:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 4, 1, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 82</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hortos in quibus devertebatur, pergunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13601.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to resort to, have recourse to</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ad magicas artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 425</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meas ad artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 62</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13601.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> (i. q. <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. B.), <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">go aside</hi> from any place or any direction; <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">go towards; to turn in, put up, lodge</hi> anywhere. </sense><sense id="n13601.6" n="1" level="3"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">viā devertit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 43</bibl></cit>: viā, Plin. <pb n="566" /> <cb n="DEVI" /> Pan. 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">devertere ad cauponem, ad hospitem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:4:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:27:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 27, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad villam Philemonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 18, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ad se in Albanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:19:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 19, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad villam suam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in villam suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum regis hospitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Massiliam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Interamnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Rhodum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 12</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">apud</hi> (late Lat.; cf. deversor): in pago apud familiares devertimus, Ap. M. 4 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl>, p. 238, 14.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">itineris causa ut deverterem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 3, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13601.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sed redeamus illuc, unde devertimus,</quote> <trans><tr>have digressed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 25, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in haec devertisse non fuerit alienum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (Sillig, divertisse).</sense></entryFree>
devescor: <entryFree id="n13602" type="hapax" key="de_vescor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-vescor</orth>, <itype>vesci</itype>, <sense id="n13602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a., to eat up, devour</hi>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">animas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:604" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 604</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
devestio: <entryFree id="n13603" type="main" key="de_vesti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-vestĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <sense id="n13603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to undress</hi> (a word used by Ap.): se, Ap. M. 3, p. 138, 24 al.</sense></entryFree>
devestivus: <entryFree id="n13604" type="main" key="de_vesti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvestīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n13604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., undressed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genitura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
devexitas: <entryFree id="n13605" type="main" key="de_vexi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvexĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>devexus</etym>, <sense id="n13605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a declivity, a sloping</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 65, 65, § 165</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
devexus: <entryFree id="n13606" type="main" key="de_vexus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>deveho</etym>, of places, <sense id="n13606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inclining downwards, sloping, shelving, steep</hi> (class.—for syn. v. declivis). </sense><sense id="n13606.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucus Vestae, qui a Palatii radice in novam viam devexus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundus in Austros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 241</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">devexus in planum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:7:1:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 7, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: ut de locis superioribus haec declivia et devexa cernebantur, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 88</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 330</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">margo (lacus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:334" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 334</bibl></cit> (with acclivus): <cit><quote lang="la">Orion,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>towards his setting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 28, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: sol paulum a meridie, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and dies devexior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">globus devexior,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 593</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvexum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an inclined surface, a slope</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua in devexo fluit, in plano continetur et stagnat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13606.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">inclining, declining</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas jam a diuturnis laboribus devexa ad otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 12" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">devexa et molliter desinens compositio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 114:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 114, 15</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">per devexum ire,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>easily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
deviator: <entryFree id="n13607" type="main" key="de_vi^a_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvĭātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>devio</etym>, <sense id="n13607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who leaves the way, a forsaker</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puritatis (Pseud.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> ad Frat. Erem. 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
devictio: <entryFree id="n13608" type="main" key="de_victi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvictĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>devinco</etym>, <sense id="n13608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a conquering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 108</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
devigesco: <entryFree id="n13609" type="hapax" key="de_vi^gesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-vĭgesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n13609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n., to lose one's vigor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
devincio: <entryFree id="n13610" type="main" key="de_vinci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-vincĭo</orth>, <itype>nxi, nctum, 4</itype> (<sense id="n13610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. sync.</hi> devinxti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 1, 21</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. a., to bind fast, tie up</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in trop. signif.). </sense><sense id="n13610.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">servum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 92</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">leonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 21, § 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dircam ad taurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem fasciis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:60:217" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 60, 217</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">opercula plumbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 29</bibl></cit>.—In Greek constr.: <cit><quote lang="la">devinctus tempora lauro,</quote> <trans><tr>encircled, crowned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:5" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 5</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13610.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bind together, to unite closely; to engage, to oblige, lay under obligation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam Italiam omnibus vinclis devinctam et constrictam teneretis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud vinculum, quod primum homines inter se rei publicae societate devinxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquentia nos juris, legum, urbium societate devinxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:59:148" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 59, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec acervatim multa frequentans una complexione devinciet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:25:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 25, 85</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:37:140" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 37, 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7</bibl> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">1: istoc me facto tibi devinxti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 1, 21</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of laying under an obligation by kindness, beneficence, etc.: ambo nobis sint obnoxii, nostri devincti beneficio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 29, 3</bibl> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">suos praemiis, adversarios clementiae specie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines benevolentia et caritate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 17, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virum sibi praestanti in eum liberalitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos centurionum pignore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem omni cautione, foedere, exsecratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se cum aliquo affinitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:26:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 26, 98</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 3, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi animus semel se cupiditate devinxit mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">animum misericordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 93</bibl></cit>: devinctus<cb n="DEVI" />  Domitiae nuptiis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 85</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">animum ebrietate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 83" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 83 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra sopore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 453</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1027" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 1027</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-vinctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., devoted, greatly attached to</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (studiis) uterque nostrum devinctus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studiis a pueritia dediti ac devincti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 4, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxori devinctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">devinctior alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
devinco: <entryFree id="n13611" type="main" key="de_vinco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-vinco</orth>, <itype>vīci, victum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to conquer completely, overcome, subdue</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13611.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">for syn. cf.: vinco, supero, fundo, fugo, profligo, subigo, subicio, domo): Galliam Germaniamque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:ib. 8:46" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> ib. 8, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">devincere et capere Capuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:33:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 33, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Poenos classe,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 13, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Crotoniatas maximo proelio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabaeae reges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 1, 29, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:5:63" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 5, 63</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catonis sententia devicit, ut in decreto perstaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 49</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">devicta bella,</quote> <trans><tr>victoriously concluded</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 370</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13611.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonum publicum privatā gratiā devictum,</quote> <trans><tr>sacrificed to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 25, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
devinctio: <entryFree id="n13612" type="hapax" key="de_vincti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvinctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>devincio</etym>, <sense id="n13612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a binding, ensnaring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magicae,</quote> <trans><tr>enchantments</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
devinctus: <entryFree id="n13613" type="main" key="de_vinctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvinctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from devincio.</entryFree>
devio: <entryFree id="n13614" type="main" key="de_vi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-vĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to turn from the straight road, to go aside, to deviate</hi> (late Lat.; for de via declinare or devertere). </sense><sense id="n13614.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Christ. 3:36" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Christ. 3, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13614.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 9:121" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 9, 121</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a vero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 23, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
devirginatio: <entryFree id="n13615" type="hapax" key="de_virgi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvirgĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>devirgino</etym>, <sense id="n13615.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deflouring</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 18" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
devirginator: <entryFree id="n13616" type="gloss" key="de_virgi^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvirgĭnātor</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">diaparqeneuth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n13616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deflourer</hi>, Gloss. Vet.</sense></entryFree>
devirgino: <entryFree id="n13617" type="main" key="de_virgi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-virgĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to deprive of virginity, to deflour</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13617.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 25, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:18:21" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 18, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenculam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sirach, 20, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13617.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> in the <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, of young persons, <hi rend="ital">to quit the period of youth</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 458, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
devitatio: <entryFree id="n13618" type="hapax" key="de_vi_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvītātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>devito</etym>, <sense id="n13618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an avoiding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
devito: <entryFree id="n13619" type="main" key="de_vi_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-vīto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to avoid, go out of the way of, shun</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">illos fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 79</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">procellam temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">letum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1092" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1092</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exiguum censum turpemque repulsam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspicionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11</bibl></cit>: <foreign lang="greek">dusfhmi/an</foreign> nominis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stultitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccl. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
devius: <entryFree id="n13620" type="main" key="de_vi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-vĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>via</etym>, <sense id="n13620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lying off the high-road; out of the way, devious</hi> (class.; for syn. cf.: avius, invius). </sense><sense id="n13620.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <trans><tr>a by-way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 3, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 10, 1</bibl> (cf. avius); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:676" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 676</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvia</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">lonely, unfrequented places</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per aspera ac devia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:60" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in devia terrarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 161</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13620.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of living beings dwelling in out-of-the-way places, <hi rend="ital">retired, sequestered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Anagnini, cum essent devii, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:41:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 41, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 4</bibl></cit>: mihi devio nemus Mirari libet, <hi rend="ital">wandering about in unfrequented places</hi>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 25, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxores (i. e. capellae),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scortum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>retired, shy</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 21</bibl></cit>: avis (i. e. <hi rend="ital">the great owl</hi>, which dwells in lonely places), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <trans><tr>leaping aside</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:804" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 804</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13620.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">inaccessible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">limina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 9, 27.—</sense><sense id="n13620.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">inconstant, erroneous, inconsistent, foolish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid potest esse tam flexibile, tam devium, quam animus ejus, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 25, 93</bibl></cit>: vita, id. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 11, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 30, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil quasi devium loqui,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>out of the way, impertinent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 44</bibl></cit>: noster Plato nihil ab hac secta vel paululum devius, Ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2, p. 352:23" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, p. 352, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo in omnibus consiliis praeceps et devius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 13, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:7:30" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 7, 30</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">devius aequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:57" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 57</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora recti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:318" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 318</bibl></cit>: devius promissi es, Mart. Cap. <usg type="style">poet.</usg> 3 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> does not occur. <cb n="DEVO" /></sense></entryFree>
devoco: <entryFree id="n13621" type="main" key="de_vo^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-vŏco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to call off, call away;</hi> also <hi rend="ital">to call down</hi>.—With <case>abl.</case> of the place <hi rend="ital">whence</hi> after <hi rend="ital">de, ab, ex</hi>, rarely without a <pos>prep.</pos>; and with reference to the term. ad quem (cf. de, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II. B.), <hi rend="ital">to call, to fetch by calling</hi> to any place, with <hi rend="ital">ad</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n13621.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem de provincia ... ad gloriam, ad triumphum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:12:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suos ab tumulo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex praesidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">refixa sidera caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:5" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovem caelo sacrificio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 2, 4, § 14</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">Jovem deosque alios ad auxilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 20, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in judicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:5:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem (ad cenam),</quote> <trans><tr>to invite</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 4, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n13621.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to call off, allure, call down</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">non (illum) avaritia ab instituto cursu ad praedam aliquam devocavit, non libido ad voluptatem, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 14, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">huc a simulacris deorum hominumque humanissimam artem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 89</bibl></cit> Sill.: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophiam e caelo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 4, 10</bibl></cit>: suas fortunas in dubium, <hi rend="ital">to endanger</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:7:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 7, 6</bibl>; cf.: aliquem in id, ut, etc., <hi rend="ital">to prevail on one to</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 6:27" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 6, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortales ad perniciem,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem ad populum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 7, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
devolo: <entryFree id="n13622" type="main" key="de_vo^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-vŏlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n13622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to fly down</hi> or <hi rend="ital">away</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n13622.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13622.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To fly down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">devolant angues jubati deorsum in impluvium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Iris per caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:702" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 702</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi de caelo devolaturam in sinum victoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 12, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13622.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To fly away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turdus devolet illuc, ubi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">phoenicem devolavisse in Aegyptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 2, 2, § 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13622.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to hasten down, to fly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hasten away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">de tribunali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipites in forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">raptim ad puerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 105, 8</bibl></cit>: ab afflicta amicitia transfugere atque ad florentem aliam devolare, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 30, 93</bibl>; cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 17, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
devolvo: <entryFree id="n13623" type="main" key="de_volvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-volvo</orth>, <itype>volvi, vŏlūtum, 3</itype>, <sense id="n13623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to roll</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tumble down</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n13623.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa in musculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 11, 1</bibl></cit>, and 2; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">saxa (amnis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auratas trabes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 449</bibl></cit>: tonitrua, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to imitate it</hi> (by rolling down balls behind the scenes), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 7, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">clipeos e muris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panem ex igne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:59:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 59, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora in humum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:574" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 574</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se toris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:235" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 235</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">fusis mollia pensa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to spin off</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 349</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13623.2" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> in mid. force, <hi rend="ital">to roll itself down, to roll</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tumble down, to fall headlong</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">monte praecipiti devolutus torrens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:5:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">jumenta cum oneribus devolvebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex praecipiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13623.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem vitā suā, to remove from,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to deprive of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per audaces nova dithyrambos Verba devolvit (the figure being taken from a river),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 4, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13623.4" n="b" level="4"> Mid., <hi rend="ital">to sink down, fall into</hi>: ad spem inanem pacis devoluti, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 4, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">retro ad stirpem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad otium et inertiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl></cit> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">29: devolvuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>hasten down</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 10, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
devomo: <entryFree id="n13624" type="hapax" key="de_vo^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-vŏmo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n13624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to vomit forth</hi>, Caecil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:23:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 23, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
devorabilis: <entryFree id="n13625" type="main" key="de_vo^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvŏrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>devoro</etym>, <sense id="n13625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be devoured</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tegmen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Ep. 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
devoratio: <entryFree id="n13626" type="main" key="de_vo^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvŏrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a devouring</hi>: carnis, Tert. Res. carn. 54.—With <hi rend="ital">gen. subject.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Tobiae, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:34:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ezech. 34, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
devorator: <entryFree id="n13627" type="main" key="de_vo^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvŏrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a devourer</hi> (late Lat.), Tert. Res. carn. 32; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Sap. 12, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:7:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 7, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
devoratorius: <entryFree id="n13628" type="main" key="de_vo^ra_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvŏrātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">devouring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina devoratoria salutis,</quote> <trans><tr>destructive to</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 1</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-vŏrātōrĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the devouring maw</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 4, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
devoratrix: <entryFree id="n13629" type="main" key="de_vo^ra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvŏrātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>devorator</etym>, <sense id="n13629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that devours</hi>: puerorum, Porphyr. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:36:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 36, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
devoro: <entryFree id="n13630" type="main" key="de_vo^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-vŏro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to swallow, swallow down, gulp down, devour</hi> (class.; esp. freq. in transf. signif.—for syn. cf.: edo, comedo, vescor, pascor, mando). </sense><sense id="n13630.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of the physical act: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod devoratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:135" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ovum gallinaceum integrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:71" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 71</bibl></cit>: laseris paululum,<pb n="567" /> <cb n="DEVO" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">salivam suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:6:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 6, 98</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">lapides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 10, 10, § 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">succum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 23, 98, § 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fumum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 6, 16, § 30</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13630.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13630.3" n="A" level="2"> Of inanimate subjects, <hi rend="ital">to swallow up, ingulf, absorb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">devorer telluris hiatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra devoravit montem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 91, 93, § 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel me Charybdis devoret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:2:74" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 2, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terras devorant aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol aquas devorans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20</bibl></cit> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">1: ne rotae devorarentur (viarum mollitudine),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13630.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To seize upon greedily</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hastily, to swallow eagerly, to devour</hi>: meretricem ego item esse reor, mare ut est; <cit><quote lang="la">quod des, devorat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spe et opinione praedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 51</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spe devoratum lucrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 24</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">regis hereditatem spe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 16, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid oculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:5:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spectat oculis devorantibus draucos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:97" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 97</bibl></cit>; cf. infra III. B.—</sense><sense id="n13630.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To swallow down, repress, suppress, check</hi>: verborum pars devorari solet, <hi rend="ital">to be swallowed</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">only half pronounced</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 33</bibl>; so, verba, Sen. de Ira, 3, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to repress</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:845" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 845</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:540" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 540</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 66" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 66 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n13630.6" n="D" level="2"> Of property, <hi rend="ital">to consume, to waste</hi>, = exhaurire: <cit><quote lang="la">omnem pecuniam publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 21</bibl>.—And with a pers. object: <hi rend="ital">Si.</hi> Jamne illum comesurus es? <hi rend="ital">Ba.</hi> Dum recens est, Dum datur, dum calet, devorari decet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 2, 71</bibl>; cf.: ut <hi rend="ital">hominem devorari</hi>, cujus patrimonium consumitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13630.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to consume, destroy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">devorent vos arma vestra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:4:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aquilarum pinnae reliquarum alitum pinnas devorant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 3, 4, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox devoratur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>is swallowed up, lost</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 51, 112, § 270</bibl></cit>: devoravi nomen imprudens, <hi rend="ital">swallowed</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">I have lost, utterly forgotten</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 63</bibl>: devorato pudore, Ap. M. 9, p. 225.—</sense><sense id="n13630.8" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13630.9" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To swallow</hi> any thing unpleasant, i. e <hi rend="ital">to bear patiently, to endure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum ineptias ac stultitias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:67:236" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 67, 236</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">molestiam paucorum dierum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taedium illud,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: bilem et dolorem, Tert. Res. carn. 54.—</sense><sense id="n13630.10" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To accept eagerly, enjoy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tibi faciam qui illos libros devorasti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os impiorum devorat iniquitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:19:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 19, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auscultate et mea dicta devorate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 59</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem dulcem (aures),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbum ipsum (voluptatis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sest. 10, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13630.11" n="C" level="2"> ejus oratio, nimia religione attenuata, a multitudine et a foro devorabatur, qs. <hi rend="ital">swallowed but not digested</hi> (i. e. heard without being understood), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:82:283" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 82, 283</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
devorsor: <entryFree id="n13631" type="main" key="de_vorsor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvorsor</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvorto</orth>, v. dever.</entryFree>
devortium: <entryFree id="n13632" type="main" key="de_vorti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvortĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>deverto</etym>, <sense id="n13632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a by-way, by-road</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">itinerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 19, 5</bibl></cit> Halm (Ritter, divortia).</sense></entryFree>
devotamentum: <entryFree id="n13633" type="main" key="de_vo_ta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvōtāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>devoveo</etym>, <sense id="n13633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cursing, anathema</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
devotatio: <entryFree id="n13634" type="main" key="de_vo_ta_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvōtātio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a making of vows, consecration</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,013:8:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 3 Reg. 8, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> 4</bibl> Quaest. in Hept. 40.</sense></entryFree>
devote: <entryFree id="n13635" type="main" key="de_vo_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvōtē</orth>, <sense id="n13635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., devotedly, faithfully</hi>, v. devoveo, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
devotio: <entryFree id="n13636" type="main" key="de_vo_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvōtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>devoveo</etym>. <sense id="n13636.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A devoting, consecrating</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13636.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">Deciorum devotiones,</quote> <trans><tr>the devoting of themselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:6:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:chapter=57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 57</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">a vow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 23, 1</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n13636.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fealty, allegiance, devotedness</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus erga rempublicam, Treb. Poll. Gall. 14: Aquileiensium pro Romanis, Capitol. Maxim. et Balb. 11: quis fortes animat devotio mentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyneg. 83 al.</bibl></cit>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n13636.3" n="2" level="3"> (Cf. devotus, <hi rend="ital">P. a. no.</hi> B.) In Christian authors, <hi rend="ital">piety, devotion, zeal</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 11 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inutilis est Deo qui devotione caret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 19, 13</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">coupled with religio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 3</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n13636.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cursing, curse, imprecation, execration</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 4, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilae in quibus devotio fuerit scripta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:ib. 6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissimulata nauseantis devotione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 103, 6</bibl></cit>; v. also <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Sat. 3, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13636.5" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Sorcery, enchantment;</hi> and concr., <hi rend="ital">a magical formula, incantation, spell</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina et devotiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">devotionibus et veneno peremisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 13</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 52: conjugium (i. e. conjugem) principis devotionibus petere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 65</bibl></cit> <cb n="DEXI" /> al.—</sense><sense id="n13636.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">any form of prayer</hi>: devotiones faustae, Ap. M. 11, p. 265, 5.</sense></entryFree>
devoto: <entryFree id="n13637" type="main" key="de_vo_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-vōto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n13637.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. intens. a.</hi> [id.]. </sense><sense id="n13637.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To dedicate, devote</hi> (rare): et me dicabo atque animam devotabo hostibus, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 98, 13</bibl> (but <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:2:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 1, 2, 12</bibl>, read devota vita); and, </sense><sense id="n13637.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bewitch, enchant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 6, 36</bibl></cit>: devotatus defixusque, Ap. Herb. 7.—</sense><sense id="n13637.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To invoke with vows</hi>: numina, Ap. M. 9, p. 227, 4: asinos cum Iside, Minuc. Fel. Oct. 28, 5. —</sense><sense id="n13637.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To curse</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> 4</bibl></cit> Quaest. in Hept. 40.</sense></entryFree>
devotor: <entryFree id="n13638" type="gloss" key="de_vo_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvōtor</orth> et <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvōtrix</orth> <itype>dicitur qui imprecatur</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 4, 607</bibl> [id.].</entryFree>
devotus: <entryFree id="n13639" type="main" key="de_vo_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from devoveo.</entryFree>
devoveo: <entryFree id="n13640" type="main" key="de_vo^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dē-vŏvĕo</orth>, <itype>vōvi, vōtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n13640.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To vow, devote</hi> (usually to a deity). </sense><sense id="n13640.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">Marti ea, quae bello ceperint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
