G. 6, 17, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Dianae pulcherrimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:25:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 25, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gnatam pro muta agna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 219</bibl></cit> et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq.: se diis, or simply se,</quote> <trans><tr>to devote one's self to death, to sacrifice one's self</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:19:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 19, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se pro aere alieno, in jesting allusion to the death of the Decii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se pro patria Quiritibusque Romanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 41, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 234</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">devota vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:2:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">devotis corporibus in hostem ruentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancipiti deum irae devotus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 39</bibl></cit>: hinc Remus auspicio se devovet, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:48:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 48, 107</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">devota morti pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 4, 14, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">without morti: stabat devota juventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:533" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 533</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput pro salute alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 2</bibl></cit>, extr. 2 et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13640.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to devote, give up, attach</hi> (rarely): <cit><quote lang="la">vobis animam hanc devovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:442" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 442</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">suos annos soli tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 683</bibl></cit>; esp.: se, <hi rend="ital">to give one's self up to, devote one's self to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">se amicitiae alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 22, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se gloriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se regibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Hist. Fragm. 1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Hist. Fragm. 1, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13640.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To promise solemnly, vow;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">obj. clause</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">qui se devoverunt, nec manducare nec bibere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:23:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 23, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totam vitam suam serviturum se esse devovit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Serm. 286, 4</bibl></cit>; Gregor. M. Homil. 1, 19, 7.—</sense><sense id="n13640.4" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To mark out, destine, appoint</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectatione omnium T. Annio devota et constituta ista hostia esse videtur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Harusp. Resp. 3, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13640.5" n="II" level="1"> Qs. to devote to the infernal gods, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to curse, to execrate</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose—for syn. cf. detestor): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natum suum (Theseus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:738" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 738</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se ipse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:6:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelerata arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suas artes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:234" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">devota arbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">devoti sanguinis aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 16, 9</bibl></cit> et saep.; v. such a form of imprecation in <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 3, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13640.6" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To bewitch</hi> by conjurations (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem carminibus, pollentibus herbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:8:18" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem trajectis lanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 7, 80</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">devota veneno corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:7:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 7, 27</bibl></cit>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I. B.). </sense><sense id="n13640.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Devoted</hi> to any one, i. e. <hi rend="ital">attached, faithful</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ni tibi deditus essem Devotusque cliens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:72" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 72</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with deditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">devotissimus alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 67 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 5:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 5, 17</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">DEVOTISSIMVS NVMINI MAIESTATIQVE EIVS,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 859</bibl></cit>; and so in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 289</bibl>: animus alicui devotus, Tiber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:67" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equester ordo scenae harenaeque devotus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 30</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">devotae in externa proelia dextrae,</quote> <trans><tr>ready for</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 311</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum DC devotis, quos illi Soldurios appellant,</quote> <trans><tr>with six hundred faithful followers</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 22, 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n13640.8" n="B" level="2"> In Christian authors, <hi rend="ital">pious, devout</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Roma Deo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filia Christo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 108, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jejunia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 1, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <hi rend="ital">obedient</hi> to authority, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Varr. 2, 16</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13640.9" n="C" level="2"> Like deditus, <hi rend="ital">given to, abandoned to</hi> a habit or thing (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">vino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 5, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvōtē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">devotedly, faithfully</hi>: devote ac strenue, Cod. Th. 6, 24, 10.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deo devotissime serviamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 86" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 86 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
devulsus: <entryFree id="n13641" type="main" key="de_vulsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dēvulsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from devello.</entryFree>
dexamenus: <entryFree id="n13642" type="main" key="Dexa^me^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dexămĕnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n13642.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a centaur;</hi> i. q. Eurytion, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:406" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 406</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dexippus: <entryFree id="n13643" type="main" key="Dexippus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dexippus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <foreign lang="greek">*de/cippos</foreign>, <sense id="n13643.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 3, 3</bibl>. <cb n="DEXT" /></sense></entryFree>
dexius: <entryFree id="n13644" type="main" key="Dexi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dexĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n13644.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 23, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dexo: <entryFree id="n13645" type="main" key="Dexo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dexo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*decwn</foreign>, <sense id="n13645.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:42 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 42 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dextans: <entryFree id="n13646" type="main" key="dextans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dextans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>contr. from de and sextans: <cit><quote lang="la">as dempto sextante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=172" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 172</bibl></cit> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n13646.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ten twelfths</hi> of any thing (mostly post-Aug.; Cic. writes instead: pars dimidia et tertia, Fam. 13, 29, 4; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">remissis senio et trientibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:Sest. 25:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sest. 25, 55</bibl></cit>), Varr. l. l.: <cit><quote lang="la">jugeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 32, 75, § 324</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gradus neque crassiores dextante, neque tenuiores dodrante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro semisse dextans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 32</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dextella: <entryFree id="n13647" type="hapax" key="dextella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dextella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>dextra</etym>, <sense id="n13647.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little right hand</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Quintus filius illius, ut scribis, est dextella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 20, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dexter: <entryFree id="n13648" type="main" key="dexter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dexter</orth>, <itype>tĕra, tĕrum</itype>, and more freq. tra, trum (<sense id="n13648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dat. plur. fem.</hi>: dextrabus manibus, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 493, 20</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> dextĕrĭor; <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> dextĭmus), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dex-ter, root dek-, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">de/komai</foreign>, whence <foreign lang="greek">da/ktulos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">digitus;</hi> cf. Germ. Finger, from fangen; cf. also Sanscr. dakshinas, on the right hand, and Gr. <foreign lang="greek">dec-io/s</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">to the right, on the right side, right</hi> (opp. laevus, sinister). </sense><sense id="n13648.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ante oculos fuerit qui dexter hic idem nunc sit laevus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 302</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:23:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 23, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars membrorum (opp. laeva),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umeri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:50:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 50, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:730" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 730</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">cornu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 7, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:52:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 52, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 23, 4</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 48</bibl></cit> et saep.: <hi rend="ital">dextrarum tibiarum</hi> genus est, quae dextra tenentur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=74:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 74, 5</bibl> Müll. et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">dextra ejus (fluminis) accolunt Deximontani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 99</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> in signification = dexter, but spoken of two only: <cit><quote lang="la">in dexteriore parte, opp. sinisteriore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 9:section=34" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 9, § 34</bibl></cit> Müll.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pars, opp. laeva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rota, opp. sinisterior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:138" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:303" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 21</bibl></cit>: cornu, Galba ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 30, 3</bibl> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: dextimus, a, um, an ancient and rare form, in signif. i. q. dexter: dextima via, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 94, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud dextimos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 100:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 100, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13648.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (perh. not in ante-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n13648.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Handy, dexterous, skilful; opportune, proper, suitable, fitting</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem ita dexter egit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et Marius scriptis dexter in omne genus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 4, 16, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis rebus dexter modus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 294</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13648.4" n="2" level="3"> (Since the Greeks regarded an omen on the right as favorable) <hi rend="ital">favorable, propitious, fortunate: dextra</hi> auspicia prospera, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=74:4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 74, 4</bibl> Müll.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">omen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:245" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dexter adi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 302</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dexter ac volens assit (numen),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4</bibl></cit> prooem. 5: <cit><quote lang="la">Jove,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:114" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:4:63" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 4, 63</bibl></cit> et saep.—Hence,</sense></entryFree>
dextera: <entryFree id="n13649" type="main" key="dexte^ra" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dextĕra</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dextra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (as in most langg.; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">decia/</foreign>, Germ. die Rechte, etc.; sc. manus), <sense id="n13649.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the right hand</hi> (freq. a sign of greeting, of fidelity; a symbol of strength, courage, etc.). </sense><sense id="n13649.1" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">cedo sis dexteram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ego te per hanc dextram oro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 5, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">per dexteram te istam oro, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 3</bibl></cit>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 10, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 94 al.</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">dexterae, quae fidei testes esse solebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem more Persarum dextra dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos libertatem atque patriam in dextris vostris portare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 58:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 58, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:291" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 291</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:7:10" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 176</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:77" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 77</bibl> et saep.: miserat civitas Lingonum vetere instituto dona legionibus dextras, hospitii insigne, <hi rend="ital">a pair of hands clasped in each other</hi>, made of gold, silver, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 54</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8</bibl> (so in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">decia\n pe/mpein</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">fe/rein</foreign>).— Prov.: dextra tenet calamum; <cit><quote lang="la">strictum tenet altera ferrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 11, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13649.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13649.3" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The right side</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">picus et cornix est ab laeva, corvus porro ab dextera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 1, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:39:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 39, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab dextera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 59:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 59, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 5 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilico equites jubet dextera inducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 88</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dexterā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 177</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 15, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 101:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 101, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 43</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">specta ad dexteram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad dexteram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 12</bibl>; Att. ap. Cic. <pb n="568" /> <cb n="DIAB" /> Div. 1, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:69:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 69, 3</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n13649.4" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the hand</hi>, in gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">omne sacrum rapiente dextra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 3, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 54</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13649.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">pledge of friendship</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">renovare dextras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 58</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecia tendit dexteram Italiae suumque ei praesidium pollicetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 10, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec veriti dominorum fallere dextras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:613" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 613</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 610</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 10, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:15:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 15, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne fas, fidem, dextras, deos testes fallat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dextra: <entryFree id="n13650" type="main" key="dextra_" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dextrā</orth>, <sense id="n13650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">praep.</hi> [orig. dextrā, <case>abl.</case> of preceding], <hi rend="ital">on the right of</hi> (post-Aug.); with <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextra sinistraque januam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:5:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextra viam stratam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 15, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextra ac sinistra aquilonem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 11, 3</bibl>; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=206:18 al" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 206, 18 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dextere: <entryFree id="n13651" type="main" key="dexte^re" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dextĕre</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">dextrē</orth>, <sense id="n13651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., dexterously, skilfully</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextre obeundo officia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 34</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo dexterius fortunā est usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dexteritas: <entryFree id="n13652" type="main" key="dexte^ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dextĕrĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dexter, II.</etym>. <sense id="n13652.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Dexterity, aptness, readiness</hi> in doing good offices (rare and not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">tanta inerat comitas Scipioni atque ad omnia naturalis ingenii dexteritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 18, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:16:1 al" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 16, 1 al.</bibl>—* </sense><sense id="n13652.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Prosperity, felicity</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, p. 225</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dextimus: <entryFree id="n13653" type="main" key="dexti^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dextĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. dexter, <sense id="n13653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I.</sense></entryFree>
dextrale: <entryFree id="n13654" type="main" key="dextra_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dextrāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bracelet</hi> (late Lat.), Cypr. Habit. Verg. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:35:22 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 35, 22 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dextraliolum: <entryFree id="n13655" type="main" key="dextra_li^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dextrālĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>dextrale</etym>, <sense id="n13655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little bracelet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Judith, 10, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dextralis: <entryFree id="n13656" type="main" key="dextra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dextrālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dextra</etym>, <sense id="n13656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hatchet</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 19, 19, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dextratio: <entryFree id="n13657" type="main" key="dextra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dextrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dexter</etym>, <sense id="n13657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a movement towards the right side</hi> (a religious ceremonial), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 45, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dextratus: <entryFree id="n13658" type="main" key="dextra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dextrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n13658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lying to the right</hi> (late Lat.): ager, pars, Auct. de Limit. p. 298 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
dextre: <entryFree id="n13659" type="main" key="dextre_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dextrē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. dextere.</entryFree>
dextrocherium: <entryFree id="n13660" type="main" key="dextro^che^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dextrŏchĕrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vox hibrida, from dexter and <foreign lang="greek">xei/r</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n13660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bracelet</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Max. 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">27, 8</bibl>: gemmatum, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:50" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dextrorsum: <entryFree id="n13661" type="main" key="dextrorsum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dextrorsum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dextrorsus</orth>, or uncontracted <orth extent="full" lang="la">dextrovorsum</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ver-sum</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>dexter-versus</etym>, <sense id="n13661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">towards the right side, to the right</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:22:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 22, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille sinistrorsum hic dextrorsum abit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextrorsus pergere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 31, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextrovorsum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 87</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dextroversum separari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
di: <entryFree id="n13662" type="main" key="di_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī</orth>, v. deus.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n13663" type="main" key="di_2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī</orth>, v. 3. dis.</entryFree>
dia: <entryFree id="n13664" type="main" key="Di_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*di=a</foreign>. <sense id="n13664.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The old name of the island of</hi> Naxos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 690</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 174</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n13664.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A city in the</hi> Chersonesus Taurica, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 86</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13664.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An island near Crete</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Standia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 61</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n13664.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A woman's name</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13664.4" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The mother of Mercury</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:22:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 22, 56</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13664.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The wife of Ixion, and mother of Pirithous</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:F. 155" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> F. 155</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

diadumenus: <entryFree id="n13693" type="greek" key="di^a^du_me^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭădūmĕnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">diadou/menos</foreign>, <sense id="n13693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wearing a diadem</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 65:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 65, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13693.1" n="II" level="1"> Antoninus Diadumenus, <hi rend="ital">a Roman emperor, son and successor of Macrinus;</hi> cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Anton. diaeresis: <entryFree id="n13694" type="main" key="di^aere^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭaerĕsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">diai/resis</foreign>. <sense id="n13694.0" n="I" level="1"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">the dividing of one syllable into two</hi>, as aquaï <cit><quote lang="la">for aquae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 7, 464</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13694.1" n="II" level="1"> In rhet., a figure, pure Lat. distributio, <hi rend="ital">distribution</hi>, Jul. <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> 21, p. 242</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diaeta: <entryFree id="n13695" type="greek" key="di^aeta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭaeta</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">zaeta</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">zēta</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">30</bibl>; and in many MSS. in the foll. passages; cf. the letter D), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">di/aita</foreign>. <sense id="n13695.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mode of living prescribed by a physician, diet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sola diaeta curari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:12:146" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 12, 146</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed ego diaeta curari incipio, chirurgiae taedet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13695.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A dwelling - place, dwelling room, summer-house</hi>, etc. (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:83" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:55:section=3" default="NO">32, 55, § 3</bibl>; Orell. Inscr. 4373 et saep.</sense></entryFree>
diaetarchus: <entryFree id="n13696" type="gloss" key="di^aetarchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭaetarchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">diai/tarxos</foreign>, <sense id="n13696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who has the care of apartments, a valetde-chambre</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. And <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> art.</sense></entryFree>
diaetarius: <entryFree id="n13697" type="hapax" key="di^aeta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭaetārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>diaeta, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.</etym>, <sense id="n13697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> <cb n="DIAL" /> <hi rend="ital">valet-de-chambre</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12:section=42" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 12, § 42</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:9:1" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 9, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diaeteta: <entryFree id="n13698" type="greek" key="di^aete_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭaetēta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">diaithth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n13698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an umpire</hi> (pure Lat. arbiter), Cod. 2, 13, 27 al.</sense></entryFree>
diaetetice: <entryFree id="n13699" type="greek" key="di^aete_ti^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭaetētĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">diaithtikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n13699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dietetics</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 200 al" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 200 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
diaeteticus: <entryFree id="n13700" type="greek" key="di^aete_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭaetētĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">diaithtiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n13700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to diet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libri, curatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:12:145" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 12, 145</bibl></cit>.—<pos>Subst.</pos>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">diaetetici</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">physicians who cure by diet</hi> (opp. chirurgi), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 200" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 200</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 3, 3</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
diaglaucium: <entryFree id="n13701" type="greek" key="di^aglauci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭaglaucĭum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n13701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a salve made from the herb</hi> glaucium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 10, 59, § 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 22" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diagonalis: <entryFree id="n13702" type="main" key="di^a^go_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭăgōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> [from <foreign lang="greek">diagw/nios</foreign> and the Lat. ending alis), <sense id="n13702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">diagonal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">linea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 5</bibl>.—And <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭăgōnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">diagonii linea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diagondas: <entryFree id="n13703" type="main" key="Di^a^gondas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭăgondas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*diago/ndas</foreign>, <sense id="n13703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Theban lawgiver</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diagonios: <entryFree id="n13704" type="greek" key="di^a^go_ni^o^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭăgōnĭŏs</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">diagw/nios</foreign>, <sense id="n13704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj., diagonal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">linea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 3, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">structura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:8:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 8, 7 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
diagoras: <entryFree id="n13705" type="main" key="Di^a^go^ras"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭăgŏras</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">*diago/ras</foreign>. <sense id="n13705.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An atheistic philosopher and poet of Melos, a contemporary of Pindar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">42</bibl>; 3, 37; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13705.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the most famous athletes in the Olympic games, a native of Rhodes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:46:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 46, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:15:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 15, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diagramma: <entryFree id="n13706" type="greek" key="di^agramma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭagramma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dia/gramma</foreign>, in music, <sense id="n13706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the scale, gamut</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diagrydium: <entryFree id="n13707" type="greek" key="di^agrydi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭagrydĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">diagru/dion</foreign>, <sense id="n13707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the juice of the plant</hi> scammonea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:12 al" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 12 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
diaiteon: <entryFree id="n13708" type="main" key="di^a^i^te^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭăĭtĕon</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">dia\ i)tew=n</foreign>, <sense id="n13708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a salve made of the juice of the willow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:13" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dialectica: <entryFree id="n13709" type="main" key="di^a^lecti^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭălectĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <itype>orum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭălectĭce</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, v. dialecticus, <sense id="n13709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">no.</hi> II.</sense></entryFree>
dialectice: <entryFree id="n13710" type="main" key="di^a^lecti^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭălectĭcē</orth>, <sense id="n13710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., dialectically</hi>, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> I.</sense></entryFree>
dialecticus: <entryFree id="n13711" type="greek" key="di^a^lecti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭălectĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">dialektiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n13711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to disputation, dialectical</hi>. </sense><sense id="n13711.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">captiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 13</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientiae professor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 53, 54, § 180</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dialecticē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">dialectically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta multa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13711.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n13711.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭălectĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a dialectician, logician</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:32:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 32, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:6:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:41 al" default="NO">7, 3, 41 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13711.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭă-lectĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. ars), <hi rend="ital">dialectics, logic</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 28, 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:6:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:4:10 al" default="NO">3, 4, 10 al.</bibl>—Also in the Gr. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭălectĭce</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 20, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:14" default="NO">2, 17, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:13 al" default="NO">2, 21, 13 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n13711.5" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭălectĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">logical questions, dialectics</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:12:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 12, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 6, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:31:119 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 31, 119 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dialectos: <entryFree id="n13712" type="greek" key="di^a^lectos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭălectos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dia/lektos</foreign>, <sense id="n13712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dialect</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dialepidos: <entryFree id="n13713" type="greek" key="di^a^le^pi^dos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭălĕpĭdos</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">dia\ lepi/dos</foreign>, <sense id="n13713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unguent made with the scales that fly from metal in hammering</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4233 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dialeucos: <entryFree id="n13714" type="greek" key="di^a^leucos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭăleucos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">dia/leukos</foreign>, <sense id="n13714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">intermixed with white, whitish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crocum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 6, 17, § 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dialibanum: <entryFree id="n13715" type="greek" key="di^a^li^ba^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭălĭbănum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dia\ liba/nwn</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">liba/nou</foreign>, <sense id="n13715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a salve made with frankincense</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dialion: <entryFree id="n13716" type="greek" key="di^a_li^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭālĭon</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dia/lion</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">dih/lion</foreign>, <sense id="n13716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant</hi> heliotropium, Ap. Herb. 49.</sense></entryFree>
dialis: <entryFree id="n13717" type="main" key="Di^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>from Dis, in Diespiter = Juppiter</etym>. <sense id="n13717.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Jupiter</hi>: flamen, <hi rend="ital">the priest of Jove</hi> (instituted by Numa, and the most distinguished of the flamines), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=84" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:6:section=16" default="NO">6, § 16</bibl> Müll.; Fabius Pictor and Massurius Sabinus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:43" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:282" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 282</bibl> et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">called also: Dialis sacerdos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: Dialis, Fab. Pict. l. l.; Tac. A. l. l.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:397" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 397</bibl>: conjux sancta Dialis, <hi rend="ital">his wife</hi> (who sometimes had a part in the sacrificial ceremonies), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:226" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 226</bibl> (cf. also, flaminica): <cit><quote lang="la">Diale flaminium,</quote> <trans><tr>his office</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apex Dialis,</quote> <trans><tr>his priest's cap</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—With a punning derivation from dies: Solent esse flamines diales, modo consules diales habemus, <hi rend="ital">consuls for</hi> <pb n="569" /> <cb n="DIAP" /> <hi rend="ital">a day</hi>, Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 3, p. 211</bibl> Bip.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 2, p. 335</bibl> Bip.—* </sense><sense id="n13717.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Ethereal, aerial</hi>: viae, Ap. M. 6, p. 179, 18.</sense></entryFree>
dialogismos: <entryFree id="n13718" type="greek" key="di^a^lo^gismos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭălŏgismos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dialogismo/s</foreign>, rhet. t. t., <sense id="n13718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a consideration</hi>, Jul. <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> de Fig. 20, p. 211 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dialogista: <entryFree id="n13719" type="greek" key="di^a^lo^gista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭălŏgista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dialogisth/s</foreign>, <sense id="n13719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an able disputant</hi>, Vulc. Gallic. Av<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cass. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dialogus: <entryFree id="n13720" type="greek" key="di^a^lo^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭălŏgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dia/logos</foreign>, <sense id="n13720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> (philosophical) <hi rend="ital">conversation, a dialogue</hi> (for syn. cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">colloquium, contio, contentio, oratio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 60 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:44 al" default="NO">6, 3, 44 al.</bibl> (written as Greek, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 31</bibl>; in the last passage transl. by sermocinatio).</sense></entryFree>
dialutense: <entryFree id="n13721" type="greek" key="di^a^lutense"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭălutense</orth> <itype>genus purpurae</itype>, <sense id="n13721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of purple mussel found half in the mud</hi> [lutum; acc. to others, = <foreign lang="greek">dia/lutos</foreign>, dissolutus], <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 37, 6, § 131</bibl> Sillig.</sense></entryFree>
dialysis: <entryFree id="n13722" type="greek" key="di^a^ly^sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭălysis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dia/lusis</foreign>, rhet. t. t., <sense id="n13722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a separation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0425,001:1:15, p. 52" default="NO"><author>Rutil. Lup.</author> 1, 15, p. 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dialyton: <entryFree id="n13723" type="greek" key="di^a^ly^ton"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭălyton</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dia/luton</foreign>, rhet. t. t., i. q. dialysis, Jul. <bibl default="NO"><author>Rufin.</author> de Fig. 18, p. 240</bibl>.</entryFree>
diamastigosis: <entryFree id="n13724" type="greek" key="di^a^masti_go_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭămastīgōsis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">diamasti/gwsis</foreign>, <sense id="n13724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a severe scourging</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Mart. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diameliloton: <entryFree id="n13725" type="greek" key="di^a^me^li^lo_to_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭămĕlĭlōtōn</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">dia\ melilw/twn</foreign>, <sense id="n13725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a salve made of meliloton</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:3 al" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 3 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
diameliton: <entryFree id="n13726" type="greek" key="di^a^me^li^to_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭămĕlĭtōn</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">dia\ meli/twn</foreign>, <sense id="n13726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a salve made of honey</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

Scip. 1, 20 sq.</bibl> al.—</sense><sense id="n13727.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj., central</hi>: radiatio, Firm. Math. 4, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></sense></entryFree>

diamoron: <entryFree id="n13730" type="greek" key="di^a^mo^ro_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭămŏrōn</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dia\ mo/rwn</foreign>, <sense id="n13730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a medicament composed of the juice of black mulberries and honey</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Sept. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:3:18" default="NO"><author>Cael. diana: <entryFree id="n13731" type="main" key="Di^a_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭāna</orth> (in inscrr. also, DEANA, Orell. 1453; 1462; 1546. Also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">Jana</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:37:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 37, 3</bibl>; cf. Nigid. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 9</bibl>. The <sense id="n13731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">i</hi> measured long, Cinna ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gramm. 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:499" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 499</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 21, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 436</bibl> P.; hence also, Deiana, Enn. ap. Ap. de Deo Socr.), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for Divana, Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*diw/nh</foreign> for <foreign lang="greek">*divwnh</foreign>; root DI-, DIV-; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*zeu/s</foreign>, also Jovis (Diovis), Deus, dies, divus, etc.</etym>, orig. <hi rend="ital">an Italian divinity</hi>, afterwards regarded as identical with the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*)/artemis</foreign>, the daughter of Jupiter and Latona, the sister of Apollo, the virgin moon-goddess (Luna), the patroness of virginity, and the presider over child-birth (in this character she is called Lucina), the chase, and nocturnal incantations (on this account her statues were three-formed, and set up in the trivia), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 23</bibl>; Catull. 34; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> Od. 3, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Carm. Sec. 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:3:19" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 3, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:155" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:511" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 511</bibl> et passim: <cit><quote lang="la">quem urguet iracunda Diana, of an epileptic,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:453" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 453</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13731.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n13731.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The moon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturnae forma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 196</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">reparabat cornua Phoebe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n13731.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The chase</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 12</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:582" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 582</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n13731.4" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n13731.5" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭānĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Diana</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>dogs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:141" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 141</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>hunting equipments</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyneg. 253</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n13731.6" n="b" level="4"> <pos>Subst.</pos>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Diānium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n13731.7" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A place</hi> or <hi rend="ital">temple sacred to Diana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 48</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=74:12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 74, 12</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n13731.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">A promontory in Spain</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Denia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 34</bibl> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 11, § 76</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13731.9" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭānārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Diana</hi>: radix, i. q. artemisia, <hi rend="ital">the plant mug-wort</hi> or <hi rend="ital">artemisia</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> A. V. 3, 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 32, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n13731.10" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Dĭānātĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a devotee of Diana</hi>, Maxim.
